Reviews.Title: “Good but could be noisy”
Reviews.Author: engprof
Reviews.Content: The staff and the hotel itself are excellent. We checked in early and were treated really well. But there is one problem. Most of the rooms in the renovated part of the hotel are adjoining--they have interior doors that can be opened--great for families but our "neighbors" stayed up all night and we had to complain. The interior door doesn't muffle the sound--you can hear them loud and clear. The hotel moved us the next night--very accommodating--but it was a bother. Otherwise, an excellent experience!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: Grace P
Reviews.Content: great hotel, got upgraded on check in, 10min to times square, 20 to 5th avenue area and columbus circle. close to multiple subways. better than being in times square as there are better restaurants and bars due to it being more residential. room was clean and spacious, bathroom could be a little modernised but was clean and functional.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: zeete
Reviews.Content: It was afew years ago when i stayed there, but I think it's still in the same place. Good location, very big rooms - we had 2 queen bed, a fridge, microwave, full bathroom ,etc - all for a walk-in price (our original reservation at another hotel was never made, the result of a mix up) for the grand total of $198/night. Can't beat it - if you're more of a neighbourhood explorer rather than a 'let's go to times square' type of traveller, this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: cathconboy
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a 5 night stay in skyline hotel . Location was very good about a 10 minute walk to times square, 5th avenue and the rocker fella center. Pj bricks joining the hotel is good value they do a buy 1 beer get another free all day every day and also have free wifi just ask the staff for password and they will give you it. Hop on hop off bus a must the night tour is fab. boat to statue of liberty 13 dollars if you buy tickets on bus tour they will charge you 25 dollars. All in all a fantastic trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean hotel and very well located from all key spots of NYC Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Subhrosonia
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently in Skyline with my wife. The best part is the hotel interior is much better than the exterior. Its very well located. 10 mins from Times Square 5 mins from 50th St subway. Also the rooms are spotless clean,large. Staffs are professional and excellent. Lots of nearby places to eat with a variety of options.The area is safe too. What more do you want out of your hotel? Finally it has a real Skyline view of Manhattan from the pool,penthouse level of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for good location in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: JrVandy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great value. Rooms were large for New York. Very clean. Staff and concierge were helpful. DÃ©cor was only slightly dated. Great location with easy walking distance to Broadway, restaurant row and the intrepid museum. The neighborhood was not the greatest, but we never felt unsafe. My only compliant would be that the walls are thin. Noise carried through the rooms more easily then newer hotels. In particular the doors all slammed loudly. Fortunately this was only noticed during high traffic times in the early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price, good skyline view!!”
Reviews.Author: tammy h
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner last year for st.patricks day! Our first trip to new york! The hotel was in a great location, 5min walk from times square and all the sights. Great view of the city from the top floor of the hotel. The room was very spacious with 2 large beds. We thought the price was very good for the time of year we went aswell. Would recoomend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, sleeping within blocks of the hot spots: Times Square, Rock, Theatres!”
Reviews.Author: TampaTrips
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel sight unseen and were thrilled with it's proximity to everything we wanted to see! A few t blocks to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, the Gray Line Tours, all the Theatres, etc. The rooms were open and big for NY. Very comfortable beds. The Concierge was incredibly helpful - even for planning before we arrived. Vending on each floor. Deli and pizza for quick, relatively cheap eats close by. We did not eat at the hotel so can't help there. Lobby is a little dated, who spends time hanging out in the hotel lobby in NYC?!!! There are 3 computers that make up the "business center" that take credit cards for computer time - email, printing boarding passes, etc. About 20 cents a minute. They will also store your bag if you arrive before your room is ready. Very helpful staff as well. We will definitely go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location comfortable bed.”
Reviews.Author: Hurstyjel
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, we had room service come in each day. Rooms were big, clean and beds were comfortable. Crystall the girl at the concerige desk was very helpful. It works out so much cheaper if you just book everything through there. Location wise wise it was about 10 min walk from times square and central park. We didn't eat in hotel, but if you walk 1 ave across then you have a whole row of lovely resturants (2 min walk)

Reviews.Title: “I just love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hourray
Reviews.Content: It might not be the one with the most updated decor and it's certainly not the trendiest, but.....where else in NYC are you going to find overnight parking for 12$, huge rooms (their cheapest room is bigger than a king sized room at "On the Avenue and about the same size as a queen sized room at the Westin Times Square) that are bed bugs free and an almost ideal location? Whenever i'm in the city with my friends or husband (and his room is not paid for by his work), I stay there, but here's a couple things to know - if you want deals, book on their website, not discount hotels site (I paid 280$ for a 2 dbl bed room and my friend paid 330$ on hotels.com) and book early (i just came back and reserved a night in 3 weeks. Staying one night in same room I just stayed in will cost me 50$ less than the 2 nights I just spent there) - rooms in the old section (rooms 1-33) are not renovated which means, no ventilation in bathrooms, phones with no indication as to how to reach another room by phone, noisy ac system. It also means that they are facing 10th ave -there is an indoor pool! - parking is almost always free uring the month of February (or so it has been for the past 2-3 years) - no shower gel or onditionner in bathroom, but there's a blowdryer

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Jo B
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a week in NYC and the skyline is amazing, the staff were really lovely and helpful. We stayed in a kingsize, and were given room 841, which is apparently one of a kind in the hotel, it had two super kingsize beds and was seriously huge, the bathroom was also amazing nd had a shower big enough for about 10 people! The 8th floor was quiet and we had good city views. The location of the hotel was perfect on 10th and 49th, a 5 min walk to times square and not far to central park, we also walked to the lower east side, soho and greenwich, so everything is accessable walking, if you dont mind a bit of excersize! We did a 3 day hop on hop off bus tour when we got there, which was brilliant to help us get our bearings. There are absolutely loads and loads of fantastic bars and restaurants on 9th ave, so a 2 min walk from the hotel, much better than the tacky expensive ones on times square. Particular favs were hells kitchen on 9th and 46th (i think) and ruby's chris steak house, which i think wason 51st and 6th, very good steak and they do a three course special at lunch for 28 dollars. There is also a bar on 10th and 50th called 123 burger that does yummy slidef burgers for 1 dollare each and beers for 2 dollars, really good and very cheap and right next to the hotel. There is also a fantastic tequileria on 9th and 47th, i would highly recommend! I will definately be back to the skyline!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a fab location!”
Reviews.Author: darkangeldeb
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here, hotel is situated on 10th avenue loads of eating places nearby and very cheap compared to the times square area.web walked to central park a few times as it wasnt that far, room was spotless and cleaned every day, staff were pleasant but to be honest didnt really have much dealings with them,

Reviews.Title: “Low key, walking distance to time square”
Reviews.Author: ElviaJ
Reviews.Content: Small low key hotel. Away from the hustle and bustle of tourist and traffic jams. Resturant on site. Valet parking on site. Pool available on top floor. Large suite with granite bathroom with tubs/shower. Two blocks from the highway which save time and money getting to the hotel and back out onto the highway when leaving. Resturants/louge on site. Drug store, bars and resturants one block east.Trains are 1-2 blocks east. Great valve for the money, compare to other well known hotels in the area. We love it when time is of the essences.

Reviews.Title: “Four day break in New york”
Reviews.Author: jan1401
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Monday afternoon from London. The staff were efficient and helpful. Our room was clean and spacious. The location was excellent just a few blocks from Times Sq and about a 20 minute walk to Central Pk. The air conditioning was a little noisy but didn't upset our trip. We would definitely go back to the Skyline.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Easygoingchap
Reviews.Content: I had a great view of the New York Skyline from my room, which I didn't expect. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Ten minutes walk from Times Square and the nearest Metro station. Ten minutes the other direction will take you to the USS Intrepid Museum, Circle Line Cruises and the NY Water Taxi that will take you to the lower Manhattan area. I would recommend this hotel any day.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay as always”
Reviews.Author: shoeindynutz29
Reviews.Content: The Skyline Hotel is our choice for a city hotel. Always a great value for city standards plus its our desired location for midtown activities. Rooms are consistently clean and the staff quite helpful. The new bar and restaurant is attractive but a bit on the over priced side. A traditional breakfast consisting of eggs cost four in our group $80 bucks. We didn't see that coming. Didn't utilize the new bar area because of breakfast prices turned us off so much, but the location is perfect for nightlife and dining within walking distance. The Skyline is an excellent stay and we highly recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space”
Reviews.Author: lagirl33
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very large rooms by NYC standards. Very clean. Only downside was it is a little far from most of the tourist attractons.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Randall P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Skyline during the week between Christmas and New Years. We arrived at 10 am and instead of just dumping our luggage, we were shown to our large updated room many hours prior to their official check-in. Service was first class and all employees from the concierge to the cleaning staff were most accomodating and helpful. Location was good including a few good places to eat nearby. We would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and value for money”
Reviews.Author: voges
Reviews.Content: We used this on a family trip.Our main aim was to go around the city rather than stay in the hotel.This was a nice place though.Rooms were good. Staff were friendly.No complaints.We did not have food from the hotel though, since there wer plenty of good places around!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable clean great location”
Reviews.Author: rosedori
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel does not look like much, but we were very happy once we went in. It was clean, double queen room was a good size, nice pool, gym has decent equipment, the attached restaurant was nice and the drinks were good. Would definitely recommend. If you plan to park there you should know that they leave a window open and carefully step on your car to get in and out so they can fit many cars. I was not happy but must admit no damage even though the car was out a few times. Who knows how many other garages do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kirst27
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my sister in law at the start of December. We stayed for 5 nights and had a fantastic stay. The hotel room was to a very good standard, very spacious and clean. Wide screen television, fridge and seperate dressing area from the bathroom. We had a very quick check in and we found all the staff in the hotel to be very approachable and friendly, who were only too keen to help. The hotel is in an excellent location for Times Square which was a 10 minute walk so we were close to all the sights. We found the area surrounding the hotel to feel very safe, we were two women alone in New York and did not have a problem walking in the area around the hotel at night or during the day. The hotel was very quiet during the night with no noise. Beds were very comfortable - we had two queensize beds. The hotel has a bar and restaraunt we had a drink in the bar once but found it to be pricey, we never ate in the restaurant. THere was internet access in the hotel which was cheap to use. Trips and shows can be booked from the hotel. We went to see Sister Act but booked it from Tourist Info on Times Square and found this to be cheaper than prices quoted at the hotel, however staff were very helpful and certainly not pushy when we enquired about ticket costs. We flew into Newark airport and used one of the transfer buses that dropped us a few blocks from the hotel and was certainly very convenient and cheap to use. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anybody planning to stay in New York. Anyone driving in New York there is a car park attached to the hotel that appeared to be secure. All in all a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and renovated with a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Kim K
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in the Skyline Hotel this weekend. It certainly isn't a hotel with a fancy lobby or a gorgeous facade but it does offer great service and renovated rooms. The room was very large, for NYC standards, clean and quiet. We found the beds extremely comfortable. The employees at the hotel were very friendly and helpful when we inquired at the concierge about the business hours of the Lego Store. The indoor rooftop pool was a plus. It was heated to 92 degrees and the kids had a blast swimming after a long day of walking around the city. Overall, it was an amazing value for Manhattan and we would stay there again. There is a parking garage, with discount prices for hotel guests, located underneath the property. It is within walking distance of Times Square and Rockefeller Center, we even walked to Chinatown but that is a hike.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Seleenaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. It's a fantastic location. We stayed in a room with two queen sized beds. The room was big and the beds were so comfortable. Parking was 10.00 per night, which was very reasonable. The only problem was there was a group of partyers on our floor. Security was good in quieting them down quickly. They broke one of the two elevators. If you are afraid of elevators, these aren't the ones for you. Get a room on the first or second floor. It's a convenient location with great service. We didn't try the restaurant, but it looked clean and it was busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bubba193
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Skyline, its clean tidy and in a great location. The bar and resturant are good value for money in the happy hour 12pm-7pm after that it is very expensive Â£5 a pint for lager, the staff are friendley and helpfull just keep tipping them Across the road 1 min away is a local bar Perdition which is cheap lively and very friendly with great staff, they will tell you all the best ways to see NY . The new part of the hotel is the best the other is a bit dated but still nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Marge310
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room with 2 queen beds,rooms clean,good beds.Very good location for Times Square,easy walk.Parking was free which is a big plus in that area. We found the staff efficient,the girl @ the tour info desk was very helpful(sorry forget your name)

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harry833
Reviews.Content: On the plus side the room, staff and location were ok. The downside was that we got a room next to the elevator, which pretty much ruined our sleep, because of a beeping sound that kept on going through the night. The interior of the hotel was somewhat worn down and in almost everyaspect the hotel was average, nothing fancy but ok. In New york hotels are overpriced, so i guess this was ok value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Price was right”
Reviews.Author: PrincessPeaNJ
Reviews.Content: We were able to get a great deal -- 2 queen beds and free parking. This is actually a small, boutique type hotel -- 2 buildings that are attached. The room was fine, but our view from room 541 was of the Amtrack train tracks -- not exactly the city view I was anticipating. The trains were not particularly frequent, but did toot the horn around 8 am. There is a small fridge in the room which is great. We bought yogurt, milk, juice and cereal at the Skyline Deli diagonally across the street from the hotel. The heat in the pool area was broken, so the pool water was warm, but the room itself was probably 50 degrees. I assume this will be fixed. The view from the pool penthouse was nice. I was surprised that we were not asked how everything was when we checked out. I volunteered that the carpet in our room had a stain and that the front of the heating unit kept falling off if you brushed up against it to open the curtains. I also would have liked some new pillows -- maybe some that are softer so that your chin isn't touching your chest while you try to sleep! We did like the bath products -- orange soap, shampoo and lotion. The small hairdryer was really powerful and located at the vanity outside the bathroom -- a really nice thing when you have multiple people sharing a bath.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but small quirks.”
Reviews.Author: megse
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights. Checkin wasn't smooth - I found the front desk staff unfriendly and rather frustrated at us, because we had a dog travelling with us. We stayed in a room with two double beds and founds the rooms to be clean and spacious. We had a special package through travelzoo, so our room was upgraded. The bell staff was fantastic. Really helpful in locating a doggy day care, and resourceful in recommending great eats (the Eatery for brunch!) and shopping (Macy's visitors discount!). The highlight of the hotel is the location. It cannot be beat if you are travelling NY on a budget. There are tons of restaurants on 9th and 8th and you are mere steps from Times Square. Excellent for exploring Manhattan without hopping the subway. Tips for other travellers - internet is rather costly, so if you do purchase it, remember that you are probably not on the internet that much anyways! Parking is valet service, but they don't make that clear. Look to deal sights like travelzoo for deals on hotels that include parking, because that is where the real deal is instead of the standard upgrades. Otherwise, parking is EXPENSIVE (as expected).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but don't leave your bags with the doorman/office”
Reviews.Author: redjett
Reviews.Content: excellent location, rooms fairly average - but expect that for the price being NYC. the Pool was nice with wonderful views of empire state building for us and the kids after a busy day of sightseeing etc. *** BUT DO NOT LEAVE YOUR BAGS WITH THE DOORMAN/OFFICE, UNLESS ALL BAGS ARE SECURE !! WITH LOCKS ETC.. THE 2 BAGS THAT WERE NOT - HAD 2 LEATHER JACKETS TAKEN FROM THEM, WHILE WE LEFT OUR BAGS AFTER CHECKOUT TO COLLECT ON WAY TO AIRPORT... - RANG & EMAILED THE HOTEL TO DISCUSS, BUT THEY DIDN'T EVEN REPLY & WELL THEY KNOW YOUR NOT COMING ALL THE WAY BACK FOR 2 COATS... But not really the point.. FOR A 6MONTH TRIP AROUND THE WORLD THIS WAS OUR ONLY BAD EXPERIENCE... *** SO for this back service would not stay or recommend them either.. cause if they take from your bag, are your belongings in your room safe ??? pretty sure there are other hotels - same price/location would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant !!”
Reviews.Author: NewYork1996
Reviews.Content: We went to New York in late October 2011, but have left it till now to write about it. Only 1 word would would describe this hotel. Brilliant!! It was in walking distance to everywhere which made it easy to get to and was not far from subways and bus stops. The staff at this hotel were friendly and helpful and they supplied us with information such as maps on the city, until the last day we didnt realise there was a small shop in the hotel which was full of New York related gifts and was relativly cheap, the bedrooms were clean and spacious and had fantastic views of the city. The facilites in the hotel were very good (swimming pool) but did not have much time to spend there as we had to sightsee and venture the city. The hotel was great value for money and would love to come back to it again. FANTASTIC!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would defo stay here again”
Reviews.Author: lauraloo2285
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic time at teh Skyline, we stayed in a Junior suite, hotel very clean, staff were very helpful. great location. Will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Short break New York”
Reviews.Author: vika6
Reviews.Content: Always wanted to visit New York and managed to do so last October. We were feeling a little uneasy about staying at the Skyline beforehand but these misgivings were very much unfounded. The hotel was very clean and the room and bathroom was more than we expected which allowed us to enjoy our stay in NY. Situated on 10th Ave at 49th Street we didn't mind the walk to Time's and Duffy's, in fact we chose a different streets both to get there and returning so in some way it felt as we were walking through different villiages each time. Across from the Skyline there's a deli which sells great breakfast rolls and terrific coffee, another tip is to use the 48hr ( hop on and off ,up and downtown) bus tours, the guides on the two we used not only are informative they entertained their passengers during the tour. All in all we really enjoyed our stay and our trip to New York and hopefully will go back and would stay at the Skyline again.

Reviews.Title: “News Flash...."Muggings and street robberies still a problem in the Big Apple"!”
Reviews.Author: knubba
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe that I payed nearly $400 for a restless night in a dirty and broken down hotel room in Mid-town! It all started off when I couldn't even get my car valet parked for nearly an hour. I finally had left the car to check in and was met with a sour attitude by the reception desk. My room was on the 5th floor facing 10th street, and the noise was constant and loud. I figured I'd try to drown out the noise with the fan/AC. Well.....I suppose since it was December they figured everybody would prefer heat, and a lot of it because that is the only setting that would work on my AC/ room control fan. It was blowing so hot I has to open the windows to let it cool off. After an hour the room finally got down to an acceptable temperature, roughly 75 degrees F. Then I closed the window and still heard the traffic as though I was walking on the street, there were no noise softening windows installed here. The shower was not only dirty, but had problems with keeping a constant temp. I tried to watch a little TV to fall asleep but the channel selection was poor, unless you pay for additional channels or movies. In addition, they charge for wifi! I could go on but it's only raising my blood pressure. Do yourself a favor and never stay at this hotel, by the way, I got a nice little ding in my drivers side door the next morning when I picked up my car. Thanks Mr. Valet! I can't believe I tipped him. Good thing there's another 500 hotels to choose from. Because I'll never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: giggsyOstendBelgium
Reviews.Content: very clean and good service,nice room and bathroom. Ten minutes on foot to times square. We had a nice stay in this hotel and would go back again

Reviews.Title: “Cosmos Tour arranged hotel (starts of US- Canada East tour)”
Reviews.Author: LeithW
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as it was part of the packaged tour of Cosmos Eastern US & Canada tour. Hotel is old, away from the time square area. need around 2 blocks of walking ie at least 10 mins of walking ( brisk walking) to reach time square area or the Metro underground. The only advantange I could think of is probably nearby Self Laundry service shop whereby it was hard to find when we stayed in time square Four Ponts Sheraton. Opposite you can find corner small grocery shop and chinese food but dont expect the food quality to be fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Little get a way with family”
Reviews.Author: Timeaway12
Reviews.Content: Went to NYC for 3 dys after Xmas. Booked 2 rooms the room I booked for my sisters and their kids was great, which was a queen room. It was a newly renovated riin and a little quieter than our room, but not a great view. Our room was a 2 double bed room, which had a great view but not renovated, but clean and descent room. The staff was super nice and the newly renovated restaurant was beautiful and had a great staff. Only a few blocks to Central Park and about a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square. Food places everywhere since in the Hell's Kitchen District. GREAT PLACE! Clean and super friendly people. Crystal at the info desk..very helpful and friendly. Would recommend and will stay there again. Parking here was a great bargain too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at Skyline!”
Reviews.Author: sunworshipper1975
Reviews.Content: I went on a girls trip to NYC, with 7 others, from November 9 - 13, opting to stay at the Skyline. This was my second trip there. First time staying right in the heart of Times Square. This hotel was one-star better, in my opinion. We had an early morning flight, arriving at the hotel around 9am. There were no rooms ready. We were able to freshen up and store our luggage in a locked room, before we hit the streets running! We left and were told the rooms should be ready mid-afternoon. When we returned around 4pm, we were able to check-in. The rooms were VERY large. Accommodated 4 ladies, all their luggage and all their shopping bags nicely. It was very clean as well. We had 2 double beds, mini fridge, iron, safe, everything we could need. The bathroom was roomy and clean as well. Beds were super comfy! We called several times for extra towels and they were brought immediately. We never waited long for anything we needed. The concierge was very helpful. We booked the shopping tour to the Woodbury premium outlets right through the front desk. If you are a shopper, this is a MUST. For $40 we got round-trip transportation and a coupon booklet upon arrival. We opted for the 8:30am departure and arrived just in time for the store openings. This is also advised as by noon, it was SUPER packed. We went on a Saturday, but I would advise to go during the week if possible. We picked the 3pm return to avoid traffic, but we could have shopped longer as there were stores we didn't get to. We opted for a shuttle van to take us to/from JFK. We paid $20 pp each way, including a tip. As far as hotel itself I would definitely return. It was only 3 blocks from Times Square. I was worried about noise factor, but we had a room not facing the street and it was super quiet. I didn't try the on-site dining but some of the other ladies did and they said the nachos were the best! We also didn't have time to try the pool as we were so busy! All-in-all, this hotel was wonderful in my opinion. I would return and reccommend!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Tree Trip 12/3/11”
Reviews.Author: palmtre2
Reviews.Content: Took the family to see the tree this year, we booked a junior suite. Perfect room for mom & dad and 2 teen age girls. Loved the holiday decorations in the lobby!! Staff is in general terrific but the front desk could smile a bit more. I shouldn't feel like an imposition if I have to use the lobby bathroom (which they lock and keycard). The girls swam in the pool at dusk, just as the lights were coming on in the city, beautiful view from the pool deck. Off to the tree - I guess the warm weather brought everyone out - it was really crowded. Line was tooo long for skating but the shopping was great. Mom & dad got up early (not an easy feat, the beds are comfy) on Sunday to take in the Hell's Kitchen Flea Market only a few blocks away, a nice brisk walk and some good buys. The new bar & grill inside the hotel PJ Bricks was good for lunch on Sunday and a nice place to wait out the kids shopping! All in all another great stay. Can't wait to do it again.

Reviews.Title: “simply superb”
Reviews.Author: Trout93
Reviews.Content: wow!!! we have just returned from 5 nights in the Skyline, the hotel staff were friendly and helpful (from the general manager that let me into his office to see some of the boxing memrobilia he had aquired over the years living in NY, to the night porter who helped me locate a pub on 2nd Ave to watch football at 07:00, and finally the bell boy Tomas who sorted our bags out and arranged a pick up at the hotel to JFK), The room for the price we paid (3 peeps) was superb, kingsize bed and fold down bed all very comfy and clean. the bar was friendly, also the guys running breakfast were very helpful. The location of the hotel in Hells kitchen area was for me ideally located, not too close to Times square to make it too expensive but close enough to walk in . All in all you have 3 happy people and would definately use the hotel again and will recomend it to family and friends 5* for us

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Adele J
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a few nights break in New York. I found this hotel through Trip Advisor and I was not disappointed with my choice. The purpose of my visit to New York was to cram in a few days sight seeing on my return home from a wedding in Vermont. I found staff helpful, the hotel room was clean and tidy, the reception area and presentation of the hotel was modern and well furnished. The best point about the hotel for me was that it was a short walk from Times Square and the Metro but was just far enough away from the noise, lights, hustle and bustle of Times Square. This meant a good nights sleep every night after busy days of sight seeing. Well priced, good location.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant holiday”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Virgin Holidays traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a christmas present for myself and two daughters, a five day trip to new york. The hotel was recommended to me by a friend who had stayed there a few years ago. It is ideally situated for sight seeing, just a few blocks away from times square.the hotel was very clean and tidy, tastefully decorated for the festive season. Room was spacious, we got a free upgrade to a deluxe queen room. Beds were extremely comfortable and gave us a really good night's sleep after all the walking done in the day. Beds were made every day and clean towels every day as well. No free wifi but it had two computers in the lobby area which took dollar bills, rate was reasonable. No noise from the street at night meant no disturbed sleep. View of new york skyline is amazing in the night especially from the windows by the pool on the top floor. Didn't use the pool but it looked inviting and was quite large. Would definitely stay there again. We were room only but there are two delis opposite which have lovely panninnis and rolls and delicious takeaway coffee! If you get a chance to go to new york do yourself a favour and stay in the skyline, it's good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “4 nights stay november 2010 was great”
Reviews.Author: jaypee0501
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not too spendy. It has smaller room and we had issues with the airconditioning/heater and management moved us to a bigger room up in the new wing. I suggest when you book in this hotel make sure you are placed on the new building as it has a lot bigger rooms and better furniture. The hotel is walk away from good restaurants and is about 20 min walk to Jacob Javits center where my convention was held. I would not stay here if not place on the newer building with better rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected”
Reviews.Author: gensey
Reviews.Content: The Skyline Hotel offers a great price for NYC. The location is perfect-a 15 minute walk to Time Square, Theatre district and Rockefeller Center. Lots of deli's, starbucks and diners nearby. My daughter and I felt safe walking back to our hotel at night. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were very clean and quiet. I understand concerns expressed by others, the building is older and in need of some basic maintenance and updating. But if you want a comfortable, clean and safe place to stay, this is a great choice. If you are looking for a more luxurious or upscale hotel, you will be disappointed. We were happy to use the money we saved to explore more of this exciting city! I highly recommend visiting Strawberry Fields in Central Park on the anniversary of John Lennon's death (Dec. 8)-we attended this year and had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “location central for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: dottyquinn
Reviews.Content: First opinion was that the hotel was a bit tired but it grew on us and we would go back, The reception and bell captain were helpful and friendly and the lounge area was comfortable and nice to relax in. Our room was 204 and the down side was we did not have any new york skyline however the room was a decent size the bathroom , towels , bedding were immaculate and the beds really comfortable.We eat in the adjoining tj bricks bar the buffet breakfast was 15-95 dollars but it did set us up for the day and the bar staff were very friendly and efficient. the location was central and we did the whole new york sight seeing using taxis and walking. just a thought it would have been nice for a kettle and tea facilities especially after a long day. There is a fridge however for cold drinks

Reviews.Title: “Girls on tour December 2011 from Durham Uk”
Reviews.Author: Joanne C
Reviews.Content: Great location for getting around. Plenty of good restaurants on 9th avenue. Safe location. Remy in particular provided a really good service and is a well experienced member of staff x

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: Stinage101
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in room 220. The room appeared clean, the mattresses seemed clean, with no bug infestation. However the air conditioning/heating unit, was falling apart. the front metal cover was broke, and barely staying connected to the unit. The room was excpetionally warm, and even with the air conditioning unit on, it failed to cool the room. The window/view had some part of the building blocking it, so you could only see bits of the city. The bathroom was OK in size, the shower nozzle leaked significantly, but the water pressure was decent, and the lights in the bathroom generated a lot of heat. The staff was not very friendly, they appeared to not really care about customer service. We did not request anything, we simply checked in and out, however by even doing that it seemed to be out of the way for the staff. The parking attendant was nice and pleasant, and $10 is a great deal. Over all, the price was decent. The hotel's proximity to Central Park, Times Square and other attractions can't be beat. If you are on a budget, and don't want to be far from midtown, I would stay here, and deal with the issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: topsoil
Reviews.Content: Hotel is priced right. Rooms are big and clean at a great price for NYC. However, hotel is very noisy from street noise and other guests. The location is about a 15 minute walk to Time Square, though you will walk through safe, but very bland streets to get there. Customer service is non-existent at the hotel from management down to the front desk. They were unavailable for questions and generally disregarded their guests. If you need a cheap clean place to stay this place is OK. I stayed their on business for a few days alone but when my wife came into town I switched hotels since it was definatly not place I wanted to spend a few romantic days nor want her walking alone in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a 5 day trip”
Reviews.Author: xlr848
Reviews.Content: Old fashoined hotel, clean but very old, perfectly situated for all the sights of New York, from our room we could see the Empire State , and easily walked to see all we wanted . Small but compact bathroom, but the shower was fantastic !!.Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great haven in the city”
Reviews.Author: GeminiBlue
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I stayed only one night at the Skyline in early December. We asked for a quiet room, and our room was not only quiet (up high facing the back), but clean, comfortable, and very spacious, and came with the two beds we needed and a fridge. We easily walked to restaurants, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, and Intrepid Museum. It felt quite safe to walk up 49th Street even late at night and there was lots to see on the way. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but there was a great coffee place up two blocks, a deli kitty-corner from the hotel, and excellent and quick pizza a block away at Uncle Mario's. Rates were cheaper than any other downtown hotel, and their onsite valet parking for $10 was a huge plus (we needed a car for later in the trip), especially since there are no easy luggage storage options in NYC. We checked out at 10 so we could do sightseeing before we left, checked our luggage with the hotel (they charge $1/bag), and were able to leave the car in the parking until 3pm. We didn't use the pool; it was actually closed the night we arrived which was odd because the hours said it would be open. The next morning it was open but we didn't have time. It looked nice enough, not real big but cool with the sweeping views of the city. The price was high, being downtown NYC. A friend suggested staying in Long Island City, which would have been quite a bit cheaper, but then we wouldn't have been able to walk to see things which for me was part of the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dated Rooms, OK Staff, Terrible Food”
Reviews.Author: neil4top
Reviews.Content: To sum up: Very Dated Rooms, OK Staff, Terrible Food.... Look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: SUSAN T
Reviews.Content: Great value especially if you are driving, the parking in same location and inexpensive. Service very nice. Casual restaurant off of the lobby. Pleasant surprise! I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and inexpensive parking”
Reviews.Author: travels46
Reviews.Content: I like the fact that the hotel provides on-property valet parking for $10 a day. The Skyline is one of the more reasonably priced hotels in the area, especially if you book using their website .My room was large and in very good condition. I like the location at 10th and 49th. There are lots of great small restaurants and bars around the hotel. It's just a short walk to the theaters.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in NY”
Reviews.Author: BlueyesOttawa_CANADA
Reviews.Content: I admit that when I first saw the hotel, I kinda went: OMG, what did I do! But honestly, great friendly staff, clean and pleasant rooms, quiet at night. Spent more time out of room than in - but that's the point right? A few blocks from Broadway and close to the subway. Parking was $10 a night and that's a steal for NY!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly sensational...”
Reviews.Author: Nadine W
Reviews.Content: we traveled to the US last September and stayed in NYC for one night. By the time we booked the hotel, we didn't really anticipate a great room, since the price was so low! The hotel is just about 10minutes walk from the "TIME SQUARE", which makes the location just great! When we arrived at the hotel we were absolutaly astonished about the room! We hab a huge room with two kingsize beds. Our little 4 year old daughter was thrilled about her own huge bed :-) The view out of our window made the hole thing complete. We had a great view at the skyline from NYC. We absolutely recommend this room and would book it again right away.

Reviews.Title: “basic but is fine for a short break.”
Reviews.Author: allanooo
Reviews.Content: lobby is pleasant p.j.bricks bar diner is part of hotel, ok.for light meals etc. rooms are clean bathroom was small, beds fine, air con old but works, overall hotel is perfectly okay for short city break at reasonable cost,location is quite good no distance to walk to 8th -7th ave for great local breakfasts. cabs are as cheap as uk. so we used them all the time did not book transfers from J.F.K took cab very reasonable 45.00$ + toll and tax. used the subway once just to experience, did 1 stop got off not nice. best trip night on the town with gray line tours booked through virgin, boat to statue of Liberty at night fantastic, ground zero very confusing you need to book a viewing ticket to see memorial site get info. prior to visit or you will just see a building site locals seemed as confused as we were,

Reviews.Title: “By NYC standards a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: plc76
Reviews.Content: Everyone knows hotels in NYC fall into two categories: Very Expensive Very poor quality Many fall into both categories, the Skyline however is different it is by NYC standards a decent hotel at a reasonable price. It is dated, the bathroom was not as clean as I would wish (long hairs on face cloth and floor) and the safe didnt work but the room was huge and so was the bathroom. The only disappointment was a man on reception who was generally surly and an ongoing problem with the electronic room key. If this were any other city I would not return but in New York it's a good hotel to use.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for NYC weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Spoodgeman
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot for a midtown weekend in NYC. 4 blocks to Times Square. Quick taxi to almost anywhere. A few blocks to the subway. Rooms are decent if dated - but who cares. How much time do you spend in the hotel room. Restaurant has good food for a decent price. Sushi is surprisingly really good. Salmon with Jalapeno - nice. Place is a deal if $300 a night can be called a bargain - but it is in NYC. Place is clean and safe. Did the Museum of Natural history - spectacular - huge - lot o walking - spent 3 hours but could spend 3 days. Times Square at night is a trip. did the horse carriage around central park - $100 - but the kids loved it. hit the empire state building. Cool and all but I would do the statue of liberty over that. Do not take the rickshaws - stupid expensive - $40 for 3 for 3 blocks - no wonder they never have people - same taxi ride would have been $5. Taxis are the way to go and short money

Reviews.Title: “Great choice! Positive experience!”
Reviews.Author: TweetTweet1020
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Skyline for our anniversary trip to NYC.. Overall, we had a wonderful experience! We had a couple minor issues but after speaking with management, we were completely taken care of. We were moved to a newly renovated room which surpassed our expectations! Michelle, the manager went above and beyond to ensure that we left having a positive experience! The beds are super comfy too! If you're in the city to see the sights, this is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Basic Acomodation That Does The Job”
Reviews.Author: Vicki52
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel purely on location - ultimately we discovered we weren't as close to Time Square as we hoped, which would have been the Perfect location in New York. We were around a 30 minute walk from Time Square - the walk was nice but we'd have liked to be closer to have made better use of our time. In the surrounding area there are shops and a McDonald's but not a great deal else! But it was fairly quiet for New York so we got some sleep. The rooms and hotel in general are very dated - everything works, but we had a tile missing in the bathroom and a shower that would flood the bathroom floor that kinda thing. We had a quad room which was fantastic - mainly because there aren't many quad rooms in New York hotels as we found when looking for hotels. The beds were really comfortable and after a long day of being on your feet all day we all got plenty of sleep without any noise or interruptions. The hotel is really clean and the cleaners always did a great job - we got clean towels everyday which was good aswell. One perk of the hotel, is that we managed to see Ground Zero - Ground Zero is fully booked until December (this was when we went in October) so the only way to see Ground Zero while we were there was to book a boat tour and combine the two... which we did - this was fantastic that we were able to see this and I'd recommend booking through the hotel as we had no problems. Being in New York, we didn't spend much time in the room or at the hotel - the one thing that we really wanted from the hotel was our boarding passes printed off. This was impossible. Reception told us to use the computer that we had to pay for - well we were having so many problems printing off the passes. We were extremely stressed out trying to get this done when we were running out of change and time. The receptionists' did now want to help at all and told us that the computer belonged through a different company and they wouldn't even walk over to see if they could try to help us. They told us to get the boarding passes faxed over to the hotel and it turned out they gave us the completely wrong number - we were absolutely furious about this as there reluctance to help made the situation worse. I can't write this review without some tips for sight-seeing: we saw the Empire State building at night then the following morning we went up the Rockefeller centre so we saw 2 different types of view but the fact that we saw them back-to-back was lovely. We went to the Chrysler building, went down 5th Avenue and THE shops of New York: Bloomingdale, Sach's, Macy's, Tiffany's and Barneys, Ground Zero (the official museum is being built and will be completed in 2012), Times Square (if you can see at night for your first time you will feel the full effect of it!), wall street, Ellis Island, Statue of Liberty, we saw a Broadway show - Wicked is one of the shows to see, we didn't book tickets out there purposely so we could buy them in New York at a discounted price....only to find out that they NEVER discount tickets and the show was fully booked for weeks ahead. There were 4 girls in totals on the trip and we did the Sex and the City Tour which we absolutely loved we luckily managed to get tickets but were surprised to see how fully booked the tour was (even 7 years after the show has ended!). We all did the Helicopter tour which was lovely and gave us incredible bird eye views but I'm not sure I would recommend it as I did a tour in Vegas (Grand Canyon) which was longer and more impressive - the tour only lasted 25 mins and cost $160. One of our highlights was doing a dinner cruise with Bateaux, we had a jazz singer, 4 course meal and window view for $230pp (Â£130) which is alot but well worth it - the views of New York at night are fantastic and this enabled us great views of the buildings and statue of liberty at night. Overall based on our unhelpful boarding pass experience I would not stay here again and I would not recommend this to friends. I hate giving bad reviews, but I really feel that if we had had better customer service then I would have left feeling more positive about the hotel. There are many hotels in New York so do yourself a favour and pick another one!

Reviews.Title: “Do not use this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: timmy595
Reviews.Content: I had to stay hear with a contiki tour and after a long flight, they failed to tell me where the tour was. The staff were quite rude. The bellman/secuirty person was the nicest person. He offered me coffee and tea and told me the tour was starting here, unlike the staff member who wanted to charge me extra nights room just for being here. The cleaning service people kept on coming into our rooms at all hours of the night. On check out day my bus didn't leave until 12 so as i was waiting the cleaning service came in 5 times to see if i was leaving. Terrible, and also the internet cost people $6 for only 30 mins

Reviews.Title: “Great basic accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Traveller290
Reviews.Content: Rooms very spacious and clean. House keeping were lovely. The front desk staff left much to be desired and were quite rude. I stayed here at the start of a Contiki trip and they didn't care about the group bookings, had rooms mixed up and weren't willing to try and sort things out. Location is great - Hells Kitchen. A short 5 minute walk to Central Park. If you stay the Skyline Deli across the road has great bagels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel very tired looking”
Reviews.Author: angeh15
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights in October. Staff on reception weren't very friendly and never managed a smile, the concierge lady though was lovely and very helpful. We were on the 3rd floor and the room was of a good size with 2 big comfy double beds. The air conditioning was very noisy and the room was stuffy. The television controller didn't work and the toilet didn't flush properly, the bathroom was very old and dated and needed a complete make over. It was good to have a fridge in the room too. We didn't do breakfast here, but went to the Deli over the road where we got hot drinks and fruit very cheaply. The location is good, about a ten to fifteen minute walk to Times Square. I would stay here again due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good price/quality”
Reviews.Author: JJ2010_11
Reviews.Content: They hotel is near the city center (about 15 minutes walking distance). The breakfast could be better but for the price, it s still ok. It was a little bit noizy...

Reviews.Title: “skyline Nyc.”
Reviews.Author: nic450
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel meeting all my requirements,big beds,five mins from times square, clean and tidy.even a flat screen tv.lovely bathroom shower etc.for the money it was faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful but a bit out of the centre”
Reviews.Author: IVCB
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights as part of a Cosmos/Archers tour in late Oct 2011. Found the hotel staff v. helpful and the place generally well appointed if needing a bit of an update in terms of the decor. Beds were v. comfortable and the rooms well sized. Main two issues were (a) that the Skyline is a bit of a walk to the nearest subway albeit buses run close by (b) the breakfast was v. limited and not v. good (cereal cartons, only one juice choice, limited range of fruit salad and not as fresh as it should have been and v. fatty bacon) -not worth the price, certainly the full American cooked option wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: islandjunkie
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC quite a bit on business and for whatever reason reasonably priced rooms were scarce for this one particular visit. Places I've stayed before wanted at least twice what I've paid recently. I saw that Skyline Hotel was priced fairly and to be honest still wasn't sure I wanted to stay there. Rather than stay outside the city I booked it. Boy was I surprised. It didn't look like much from the outside but you know what they say about a book and its cover. The lobby was very clean and check in was smooth - in fact they upgraded me to a suite. The room was huge with a separate sitting area. Bathroom was very clean. The location was perfect for me as it near where I needed to be but in general Skyline is centrally located and convenient to all the major attractions in NYC. I think 9th and 10th Ave are great for reasonably pricing restaurants and you would be hard pressed not to find something to your liking within a few short blocks. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the couch in the room!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy33857
Reviews.Content: We searched for a NYC hotel and found The Skyline Hotel to be a good value! Also, they offered us very reasonable parking while we were there! We found the location to have easy access to all of New York's sights and restaurants! We will be returning to The Skyline Hotel again! K-

Reviews.Title: “Good Stuff”
Reviews.Author: cardiffman123
Reviews.Content: Clean, Tidy and all that you need when in NYC for 5 days!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: sportymom2
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NYC and quite frankly, I was OVERWHELMED with the amount of hotel choices!!! After speaking to a few friends who'd been to NYC, we decided to stay close to Times Square and found a GREAT deal with this hotel ($189.00 per night). It was a very large room, 2 double beds, separate washroom area and large closet AND a mini fridge. Although the hotel is not on a main strip, it is really close to EVERYTHING! Staff was very friendly and alothough we didn't use it, parking was only $5.00 per day. A real bargain. At the time we stayed there, the hotel did not have a restaurant but that did not bother us in the least. I totall recommend this hotel and we will look to stay there again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Lewis M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in September 2010 for 3 nights and overall found it to be an enjoyable stay. The beds were comfortable the rooms were quiet considering our room overlooked 10th Ave which was great as we had a cool view but didnâ€™t compromise our sleep! The staff were excellent as well always polite and happy to help the young lady at the concierge desk was very helpful and got us a good price on an express pass for the Empire state building ( the express pass is a life saver as queues to the top are massive!). Also the pool was very nice with a great view of Midtown, best time to go is early evening as the views from the pool were cool with the sun going down and the lights coming on over at times square! Best thing about the Skyline? Location! You can walk to Times square and central park in about 15-20mins and thereâ€™s loads of nice restaurants and bars near by (I recommend the Route 66 diner myself on 9th & W56th) you can also catch a cab downtown and itâ€™ll only take 10-15 mins depending on traffic of course. Overall itâ€™s not luxury but itâ€™s not squalor! You are getting a reasonably priced hotel with good amenities in a great location and for me that ticks the boxes I need. Enjoy New York!

Reviews.Title: “Got the crucial things right, but little else and some large downfalls”
Reviews.Author: Jason P
Reviews.Content: Good things:- *Rooms are clean and bedding and towels *Location is excellent, right on 10th Ave next to time square *Parking next door, valet service for only 10 dollars a night (not owned by hotel) Bad things: *The Hotel is run down, reception is nice! But look closely and the place is in need of a lick of paint badly, you will find old damaged tables and cabinets in rooms and tv arial sockets out of wall *As soon as you walk in your credit card will be pre authorised and held for the full room price (approx Â£200 per room), I had two room so Â£400 was held, reviewing over 48hours since my return, they still have my money! *Staff - Dont get me wrong some (lady on reception and bell boy manager) on first day were both helpful and friendly. But unfortunately the other 50% of staff let the rest down! *Everything they could possibly charge for they will - Storing your bags, using the computer in the loby, breakfast and tea and coffee facilities etc etc, nothing is free!!! All in all I would stay here again purely because of location and price for NYC, but everyone should be aware of the downfalls

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for bigger family!!”
Reviews.Author: norwegianprincess7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Skyline Hotel with my husband and 3 daughters recently. We upgraded to a Suite and the rooms were absolutely huge for NYC hotel rooms. The Suite has a separate room with a pullout sofa and a tv, with French Glass doors. The hotel is one of the few that has a pool to offer as well. And lastly, the parking is the cheapest I've ever paid in NYC for valet. Of course, no in and out priveledges, but I think we paid $24 for 24 hours.....The hotel is located in the "Hells Kitchen" area, which we found to be for what we had planned to do on our visit. Honestly, for the price is was an awesome deal. It's located on 10th avenue and I think 52st, just a short walk to Times Square. The Avenues are LONG blocks compared to the street blocks, but we were up for a walk. I would highly recommend this hotel with bigger families!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable but disappointed with lack of information”
Reviews.Author: Sharon M
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 7 night stay at the skyline hotel and must say I was disappointed with the lack of information when checking in to the hotel and I found the reception staff to be quite abrupt. The hotel is due to open there restaurant and have a section of this open for Hotel staff we werent told this and only discoverd this when going to use the hotel pool. We spend our first few days trying to find somewhere decent for breakfeast would recommend the Citylight Diner which was just up the road on 52nd Street. There was no information in the room but the room was very comfortable and the maid service was very good, however the air conditioning was very noisy and it took a while to get used too. We did have a fridge and the bathroom was very nice.The female on the Concierge desk was most helpful but again found the older male abrupt and unhelpful. The Bell Captain and others on the door were very friendly and helpful. I enjoyed my stay but if we were told more when we checked in we could have dined in the restaurant instead of walking about hungry most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Sue502008
Reviews.Content: The rooms here were clean and comfortable and quite large rooms. The staff were not very friendly, and the concierge went home early leaving you unable to book a trip for the next day (which happened to be our last day). The lack of a bar was a big disappointment, no where to sit in the evening and just have a relaxing drink. Also, tea making facilities would be a big bonus in the rooms. On the plus side, it was very convenient location and The City Light Diner over the road was an excellent place for breakfast with brilliant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: sdpinParis
Reviews.Content: Took my daughter for her 18th. We had a wonderful time, the hotel was only minutes walk from Times Square and 15/20 minutes walk from central park. The staff were wonderful and ready to help. The beds comfortable. Would only criticise the air con (very noisy) - we slept without and the taps drip - ok if your beds are far from the bathroom. The pool was wonderful and relaxing. We opted for breakfast in the NY diners, which I would definitely recommend. All in all, I would definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not ideal”
Reviews.Author: Paros81
Reviews.Content: Booked on recommendation of a travel agent because of location and fact it has an indoor pool. Is quite central however area a bit dubious at night and sited on a busy arterial road. Pool was adequate but end of season and needing a deep clean. Poolside staff also seemed tired and jaded. Chose to go back to room to change as changing area rather grubby. Room itself clean and well appoined - make sure the window is completely shut to avoid road noise. May then need to use air conditioning which was itself quite noisy though. Didn't take breakfast in hotel as lots of local alternatives including an excellent deli for take away opposite hotel. Breakfast area being renovated. Overall security in hotel rather lacking - felt like an upmarket bus station at times with people coming and going unchecked. Staff at reception helpful and pleasant however. If I return to NY I would look for a better hotel and expect to pay more

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel for a few days in NYC.....”
Reviews.Author: gkel2003
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for a short stop in NYC, we went to NY for 3 nights and this little hotel did us fine. Didnâ€™t have much interaction with the staff so cant really comment on their helpfulness but for check in and out we found them good. Concierge was good, recommended us well. Food in the hotel i.e. breakfast little on the expensive side for what you get, but hey itâ€™s NY same in London reallyâ€¦. Good location, short walk to Times Square (around 10/15 mins) Rooms standard, beds comfyâ€¦. Disappointed no tea or coffee making facilities

Reviews.Title: “Value, Location, Views”
Reviews.Author: dansoleau
Reviews.Content: I found a rate online for this hotel that seemed too good to be true. $215 (AAA rate) for a Friday night, 2 queen beds, 410 square foot room in NYC. For those of you who know NYC hotels, that's a really really good rate. The hotel had positive reviews and was well located (10th Ave and 50th St). It also boasted a $10/night rate for parking - unheard of in any major city. Total including room, taxes, and parking was $260. When we (I went with 4 friends) arrived to the hotel, we had some misgivings... The exterior looked like a dull 1950's motor lodge hotel that was under renovation. We went into the lobby area to check in and were pleasantly surprised by the difference between the hotel's exterior and interior. The front desk area was a bit cramped and the overall decor in the lobby area was a bit "overdone traditional", but it was clean and well kept. We stowed our bags with the bell desk as our room was not yet ready. After wandering around town for a bit, we went back to the hotel to check in. There was a slight snafu regarding the rate (I had to pull up my confirmation email to show them the rate I made the reservation at) but it was quickly resolved and we got the keys to the room. The hotel has a bit of a sprawling ramshackle pieced together feel that isn't at all unpleasant. And then we got to the room... We were all very surprised by our room. First of all, it was obviously recently renovated. Everything looked new and modern - different from the exterior of the hotel and it's common spaces. Secondly, it was HUGE. 410 square feet is pretty good sized for most standard hotel rooms, but in NYC it's simply massive. There was plenty of space for the 2 queen beds, the armoire which had a nice new flatscreen TV (with plenty of cable channels) perched on top of it and an empty mini fridge stowed inside of it (inside of which we stowed beer, wine, water, etc), the bench and luggage rack, and the desk. The beds and bedding were nice and comfortable. There was a vanity built into the room next to the smallish closet. The bathroom was also recently renovated and wasn't at all cramped. We then opened the curtains and admired our fantastic view of the New York City skyline. We weren't in the room for more than 5 minutes before the bellman promptly arrived with our luggage. Later in the day we went up to the penthouse pool. The star of the pool area was again the views of the skyline. The pool area could definitely stand to be renovated, but the space was large and open and there aren't many pools in the city. The whole stay was great. All the hotel staff we encountered were pleasant, friendly and helpful. This hotel represented extraordinary value. But even beyond value, the room was nicer than many of the 4 star hotels I've stayed in. I would most definitely stay at the Skyline again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: morgyn
Reviews.Content: Very handy hotel to stay in when in new York, nice sized rooms, clean and functional, easy walk to times square, rates ok too,

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: St_Louis_MOVicki
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, and we had no complaints. Convenient to mid Manhattan and the cruise docks. A great locatiaon if planning to sail from Manhattan and catching a few days of NYC before the cruise. It was close to the Theater District as well as Times Square. The subway was nearby, and we walked to most attractions. Clean, convenient, and on the lower range of price. If you are seeing Manhattan, what more can you want?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Listen to the Concierge.”
Reviews.Author: bouncearound
Reviews.Content: I do a lot of travelling around and NY is one of my favorite stops. I stumbled across some reviews of the Skyline and figured I would give it a chance. The rooms were lovely and pretty much the perfect size for me. The staff was nice and friendly. My biggest applause goes to the Concierge desk. Crystal was friendly, helpful and gave some lovely recommendations. I would definitely stay there again next time I'm in town, and I highly advise listening to Crystal. She was great. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickpat
Reviews.Content: ok location not too far to alk to circle line boat cruise, times square. room comfortable and good size. great breakfast in the coffee pot only 1 block away. not 5 star but adequate ina fantastic city. good bars and restaurants close by, staff helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: scott r
Reviews.Content: I was caught in a last minute spot to book a hotel for business trip. The rooms are very clean, and the hotel is located close to mid town office. The rate was good tho, so hard to complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but avoid the pool!”
Reviews.Author: Afrikat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first few days of our honeymoon and wanted somewhere convenient and not too expensive. It definitely ticked both those boxes - the location is excellent and price reasonable by NY standards. We got upgraded to a suite so our room was very large, not sure about the standard rooms but ours was more than adequate. There is a pool at the penthouse level but I would avoid this at all costs - it was filthy and they were obviously doing work on that floor, with carpets being ripped up and the flooring being exposed. Hopefully this area will be improved soon.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & convenient location”
Reviews.Author: SheBGeorgia
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel for our group. We had plans out and about each day and did not plan to hang around the hotel. It was clean and comfortable and the location was convenient being just a few blocks off Times Square. We are a middle aged couple and had no problems walking to area attractions. Staff was cordial. Taxis were always available and tour bus options were only blocks away. There is a restaurant & bar under construction currently that was first advertised to be complete "Summer of 2011" and now sometime in October. They offer an ok buffet bfast in a banquet room, just ok. There is a small deli across the street that had good coffee and delicious pastries in the morning. Also had great selection of deli offerings that you could get to go for snacking later. The pool on the top "penthouse" floor had limited morning and evening hours and the night view of the skyline from that floor was beautiful, not from anywhere else in the hotel. If you have a group, I highly recommend Carmine's on W 44th St for family style Italian food. Large platters of delicious food. Ck them out at www.carminesnyc.com. We went after seeing a play and enjoyed the experience greatly! Plenty of adequate photos already available with other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Surprized”
Reviews.Author: 1crisp
Reviews.Content: Do not go to this hotel if you are wanting luxury,go to a midtown hotel and pay double the price,the staff were mostly plesent and helpfull ,the parking at $10 a night is very cheap,we had a room at the back of the hotel and was very quiet,another review said their room was small ehh they must have slept in the bathroom as ours was a good size with plenty of room to walk about and we had a safe and a little fridge but the aircon was a little noisy,the beds were comfy and the room very clean,the bathroom was decent but needed a little touch-up here and their but clean,the hotel is only a 10 mins walk to Times Square and has plenty of eating places within 5 mins walk.IF you want a decent hotel at a decent price then this is a decent hotel.IF you want luxury and pampering and you want to spend all your time in your hotel then go and pay twice the price,only stuck-up people will give this hotel bad reviews,not only would i go back to this hotel i would recommend it any non stuck-up decent person.

Reviews.Title: “extremely accommodating, recently updated”
Reviews.Author: joemascaro
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd trip to NYC over Labor Day weekend staying at the Skyline. Not very fancy on the outside, but don't let that fool you. They have a great staff, concierge was fabulous in helping me with tickets to a Yankee game. The neighborhood is going through a positive change and the management at the Skyline has certainly made some nice improvements to the Hotel. The room we stayed in was spacious with a very comfortable couch, very clean and modern. They are expected to open a new restaurant in October which will be a nice benefit. Parking is very reasonable and convenient. Nice hotel and getting better.... we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: DaveyPez
Reviews.Content: Great place! Run of the mill cruddy American interior design and matter-of-fact levels of service but who needs more? Location is good with plenty of small restaurants at hand (great Thai across the street) and a short walk to the subway, Times Square or the Hudson ferries & Intrepid museum. Best bit for our 11 yr old was the indoor pool. Our only complaints were exorbitant internet costs and noisy air conditioning - but thatâ€™s better than the 80+F outside!

Reviews.Title: “Both pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: ter10242003
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Skyline for one night, and while I guess it was a satisfactory experience, I wasn't completely happy with everything. Pros- great location, friendly reception, no bedbugs, comfortable bed, great bathroom, lots of TV options, quiet Cons- tiny room, toothpaste smeared down the side of the desk, cigarette burns on the carpet and on the blankets, air conditioner barely worked For $250/ night, I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, decent location!”
Reviews.Author: Scott R
Reviews.Content: I've been to NYC 3 times, I stayed at the Skyline on my second visit. It was the cheapest hotel of the three (others being The Muse Hotel and The New Yorker Hotel). The hotel was clean and tidy and very spacious for NYC, we had a standard room with two double beds. We had a fridge and safe at no extra cost which was very convenient. The staff at check in were very helpful and friendly. The pool and gym were great, only used once but its good to have them if you have the urge to get some exercise although walking around the city is more than enough exercise! I would stay here again as it was such good value and it really wasn't far from times square or a subway station. There were lots of bars and restaurants near by too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, spacious rooms, cheap parking - will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: Kingston93
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Skyline for a family vacation. We were looking for a hotel that was within walking distance to Times Square and Central Park but far enough away that we were not affected by the crowds. We were also looking for a hotel with Queen beds and cheap parking. We found it all at the Skyline. Ten minute walk to Times Square. 20 minute walk to Central Park. Parking $10/day. Rooms were very spacious for New York standards. We had a view of the Empire State building from our window. No wifi in the rooms which meant that the teenagers were eager to get up and get going in the am (free wifi at Times Square). Lovely breakfast diners in the area. This part of the city, once known for it's reputation (Hell's Kitchen) is perfectly safe and is full of character. We would definitely go back and would also recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for exploring Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: Bamble
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed here 4 nights as part of our honeymoon. The taxi from the airport was reasonable at $50 and only took about 45 minutes. On arrival the staff were friendly and the lobby very clean and smart. Our room was perfectly fine too, nothing special but clean, tidy, spacious and comfortable beds. Shower was a bit small but otherwise no complaints. Nice view, you can just make out the top of the Empire State building. Although the area the hotel is based in, Hell's Kitchen, wasn't the nicest district in NYC we saw it is good as a base for getting around. Times Square and Broadway is about 10 minutes walk. The Empire State building was about 20 minutes and Central Park about half an hour. Because it's right on 10th Avenue it was really easy to get a taxi as they were coming past constantly. Before we went I read some awful reviews of this hotel so was quite worried. Happily enough, they weren't true. No the rooms are not luxurious and posh but I would stay here again if I came back to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable value!”
Reviews.Author: amye64
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were In town mid-week for the Gift Show and found The Skykine through the NYGIF website accomodation section. Due to the unbelievably reasonable rate offered and the "ideal location" specified we were not so sure what to expect, but the The Skyline didn't disappoint! The staff was very welcoming and accomodating, we arrived early and and our bags were happily stored and the car was parked (at the published discounted rate of $10, no less!) We were able to easily walk to the gift show shuttle during the day and then easily explore the great Hell's Kitchen restaurants at night! Hibernia Bar and Lime Jungle were our favorites! Our room was quite comfortable and spacious and we were able to enjoy a quick dip in the pool before it closed (where the pool attendant was so nice, even though it was right before closing ). My only regret was that I didn't make it back up to the penthouse floor to get a picture of the beautiful skyline before it closed! Next time, for sure! It would be great to get a room with that view next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings, but would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: shanaamy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in early August. I will start with the good and the reason we would return. It's a great location, just 10-15 minutes walking distance from time square and central park. The room was spacious and the pool and cheap parking added value to this property. The room was nice with the exception of the carpet, (wear flip flops). Now the not so good; we had a lot of issues, but the hotel staff and manager were accomadating in taking care of them. We had both the safe and fridge malfunction. Not normally a big deal, but when your storing medication, this is a big problem. We had ants in the room, but they quickly brought in an exterminator (it did leave a funny smell). My husband came back to the room to take a nap and was rudely awoken by some sort of construction in the next room, he said it scared the crap out of him and he didn't wake up to pleasant (bad for me). Having said all this, I would stay again as we felt safe and I will take ants any day over bed bugs!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price, location, and ove average property”
Reviews.Author: HumbleFoodieNB
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel for the traveler not fooled by the lure of Times Square hotels. It is a 5-10 minute walk to times Square, but at a much more reasonable price. Our room was extremely clean, spacious with comfortable amenities. They have done a lot of renovations and upgrades. Very nice pool, comfortable lobby. You cannot beat the accommodations or service for the price! Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: mellymitten
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about the location, only a 10 minute walk from Times square and central park. Hotel was very clean and had maid service everyday. Great value for money and cant complain, staff were very quick to sort out any problems we had with our room, view from our room wasnt great but we didnt mind as we only used it to sleep. pool looked a bit dated but the gym was very new and good condition. would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Janet K
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel is the close to everything we wanted to see and a short walk from the subway station. My kids loved the train that goes under the hotel, it was an added attraction at no cost. We bought tickets at the hotel to go on a ferry around the harbor, the pier was about 4 blocks away. We had a full big breakfast at the corner diner for around $30 for four people, which is a great value in the city. We will be stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Average but good location”
Reviews.Author: cheryllewis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in february for 8 nights with my husband and 2 young kids. The hotel is in a very good location ,close to almost everywhere central you wish to go to,we walked a lot just to see the city better,one day in particular from ground zero all the way back to the hotel-not recommended everyday though. The hotel is as rated 3* ,slightly disappointed with the rooms they could be doing with a renovation,didn,t like the downstair breakfast/lunch are it was definetly in need of a refurb, overall a reasonable priced hotel,if we went back to nyc ,we probably would go elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Exactly The Right Place!”
Reviews.Author: pmcnoahs
Reviews.Content: This hotel, where my daughter and grandson also stayed for a few days, is conveniently located for anything on the est side of Manhattan, if you use the subway and take the E train from 8th Avenue and 50th Street close by, or walk to 42nd Street with lots of choices, you can be on the east side in a few mintues. We walked about 50 miles, I'm sure, in the week (Wednesday - Thursday, July 20 - 28, 2011), going to shows, the McQueen exhibition at the Metropolican Museum (what a wonderful experience) and the Museum of the Moving Image in Queens (R train, plus lots of other places.
