THE HOTEL HAS A GREAT STAFF, THE CONCIERGE IS HELPFUL AND ENTHUSIASTIC (DON'T GO TO MARS 2012 UNLESS YOU ONLY WANT A CHILD-CENTERED EXPERIENCE WITH BAD FOOD). ROOMS ARE ADEQUATE, CLEAN AND NO BEDBUGS - A BIG DEAL IN NYC! GREAT POOL WE USED EVERY DAY (SWAM AT 7 A.M. AND WERE FREE THE REST OF THE DAY). GYM, TOO.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the food”
Reviews.Author: dmb100
Reviews.Content: Front of house staff were really helpful on arrival and the lobby area was an impressive standard. We had a room on the side at the start of our New England Tour and a room at the back at the end. The corridors and lift were a little "tired" and in need of updating. Our first room was quiet but again in need of decorating. First requirement of a room: must be clean, and it was. Our room on our return from the tour was more recently renovated and a good standard. Dining area was boring and tired. No bar area. They only did breakfasts. But many restaurants nearby. Location is like 10 mins walk from Broadway/Times Square and a little longer to Central Park. Great location for a short stay and if you always want to dine out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with huge rooms for NYC - Gareth (England)”
Reviews.Author: garethleeds1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Skyline in February after booking at the last minute. I stayed here 5 years ago when the hotel was mid renovation so much preferred it this time. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Times Square on the edge of Hells Kitchen, it was surprising warm this year so the walk to the sights was pleasent but when the cold hits make sure you have wrapped up warm. The Skyline is only a few stories high so I did always wonder why it got its name but this time I found out. Take a trip up to the pool and there is a simply stunning view of the New York City skyline. The rooms for New York standard are huge (have stayed in higher star rated hotels in NYC which had tiny rooms in comparison). They were very clean and had full cable channels which was good when you fancied a rest. My only grumble was the bath with a faulty plug hole which despite telling reception on 2 occasions never got fixed but if thats all you can complain about you know your doing ok. To sum up I would highly recommend the Skyline hotel and remember to check out the view.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected”
Reviews.Author: BruceMoguls
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4, and we were in NYC for a 4 night stay. I was on business, and my wife and two young sons were touring Manhattan. We wanted something near Times Square, but not right in Times Square necessarily, and we were looking to spend under $300/night. It was mid-July, so a pool was a bonus we were also looking for. The Skyline cost us about $250/night. Located about 5-6 blocks from Times Square, easy walk. Our room was actually quite nice, it was one of the renovated rooms with two double beds and more spacious than many rooms in NYC. The pool was OK, not great, we ended up only using it one day. We didn't try the restaurant, it didn't look interesting at all. From the outside, the Skyline looks a little sketchy, but all in all, it was a nice hotel and really exactly what we expected for a 3 star hotel with a decent price in a good location in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “We love New York! Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: milkweed
Reviews.Content: We did our family vacation to the Big Apple (first time to this city) this year and it was great! We wanted a hotel that was near Times Square but not right there so that we could get some sleep at night. Since we are travelling with children (8 and 6), we were looking for a space that had at least 2 dbles in one room. We stayed at the Skyline for 6 nights and got 2 queens in one room. The room was spacious; an excellent fine for NYC. The most important requirement for an NYC hotel in the summer: A/C and it worked great. The pool was a good too, it allowed for the kids to relax before bedtime. Although they did not have complimentary breakfast in the hotel, there is a great deli place across the street from the hotel. You could get an bagel egg sandwich for less than $3.00. And the food was freshly made. Great service there; even the cops eat there every morning. The only minor down point was that there was no free internet in the room. We also found organic fruits foods at a grocery store at 50th and 8th. If you go to 50th and 8th (5-10 min walk), you could catch the Hop on and Hop off buses. These were good for little tired legs in NYC. We could stop at the attraction and enjoy each one. Our kids liked the American Natural History Museum and the Police museum (I thought it was ok), my favourite museums were the MET and the Tenentment Museum (these tickets sell out quickly, great educational tour for school age children). Statue of Liberty was inspirational. Central park was great--We found the Alice in Wonderland statue. We also did a night tour on the bus and when we were in Brooklyn there were fireworks--it was beautiful to see New York at night. My husband and I both prefer the Top of the Rock over Empire State building's view. Although the art deco style of Empire state building was wonderful. The public library was beautiful especially the ceilings in the reading rooms! FYI: you can get free internet at the library. We ate at Katz's one night, it was such a NYC moment. Excellent meats though, a-must dining experience while in NYC. We did not get a chance to shop but I did manage to get 2 tops in SOHO after the Katz's dinner; it was within walking distance. We accidently rode the wrong subway train to Harlem and a really nice gentleman told us how to go to the correct train. The subways are as bad as it was previously portrayed. We found most of the New Yorkers were very helpful. It was also great to meet people from different parts of the world. Overall, we will definitely go back to New York City again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location in New York City”
Reviews.Author: questo
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the Skyline Hotel in March while participating in the NYC 1/2 Marathon. The hotel is convenient to the subway, the theatre district and there are plenty of good restaurants nearby. Our room was on the 3rd floor, facing west, towards the Hudson. No view, but that's ok as we didn't stay in our room except to sleep. The room was quiet and because of where it was located, did not get much of the typical NY traffic noise. The room was o.k. however one day, the maid never showed up until 4 pm. Since we had run the 1/2 marathon that day, when we came back to the room later that afternoon to rest and clean up, the room had not been cleaned yet. The maid showed up, but since one of our party was sleeping, decided to forgo the cleaning and just got a bunch of clean towels. Amenities in the bathroom were limited to soap, but as this is a mid-range hotel, we didn't really expect any more than that. The AC was iffy and not consistent. Even though it was winter, the room was stuffy and too warm, so we had to open the windows. Beds were comfortable, which except for cleanliness, is one of the things that concerns me the most when picking a hotel. The hotel has a very nice and apparently newly remodeled fitness room. There is also a pool, which we did not utilize, but if you have children, would be a nice amenity. The hotels' restaurant consisted of a conference room that had been turned into a dining area. They are remodeling the restaurant and I believe that it should be open by now. Not to worry as there are plenty of excellent restaurants nearby. We ate at a couple of the pizza joints nearby and some very good bistro type establishments. The theaters are a 10-15 min walk away and the subway is 7-10 min. walk away. They do charge to hold your bags if you arrive early before the 3pm check-in time and charge you again if you check out and need to leave your bags prior to actually leaving the hotel. I would stay here again if I was able to get the same rate I paid this time ($129 plus taxes) which is a good deal for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “NYC”
Reviews.Author: Nicolicious9
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was good. The location was fab and when going to new York city I think that's what is most important. Hotel was comfortable and clean and staff friendly - but in truth if your spending alot of time in your hotel in new York - ur missing out. It was a place to sleep for us only. Deli across the road was fab, should defo try there paninis x

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Farrrrrah
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs quite a bit of renovations. The hallways need to be ventilated properly, you will notice a stench smell as you walk through and the furniture needs to be upgraded. It is in a decent location if you want to be close to Times Square. It is also very close to 9th Ave where there are quite a few eatting spots. If you expect to spend little time in the hotel, this place is ok. Nothing amazing and it is a bit pricey but that NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: karenpStLouis
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in NYC. Within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park, etc. Rooms are normal size hotel rooms not the typical tiny NYC rooms! And as an added plus, parking is only $10 a day for guests!! There is a nice indoor pool and exercise room also!

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accommodations and decent price for NY”
Reviews.Author: spunky022
Reviews.Content: For the price the hotel was ok. The location is great, you can walk to many places, if not a taxi is always out front. The only issue I had, was the bellman. He charged us for storing luggage, even though the receipt says that there is no charge. I wish I had disputed the charge with him. Quite silly, as I would have tipped him anyway, now I am just annoyed with him.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Karina01
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here in May 2011 as part of our Contiki tour. We weren't meant to stay here but due to our other hotel being overbooked we were moved here unexpectedly. We found the location to Times Square within reasonable walking distance and subway stations. Our room was a decent size and the beds were comfortable. Found the reception staff weren't overly friendly. The doorman was very friendly and polite however. I unfortunaley got food poisoning (from somewhere not connected to the hotel) and when i was asking for assistance (being from Australia and not sure how the US health system worked) i found that the staff weren't overly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here back In January... loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: capecodjohn
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the skyline back in January before our cruise. Being cautious I investigated several places and chose this one. Needless to say We were very happy with our choice. The location is great, the rooms are big, clean and quiet. The beds were very comfortable and the staff was incredibly friendly. I have nothing but good things to say about the skyline. In walking distance are some great restaurants and we chose a greek place and we loved it too! If you want to stay at a clean place that is not overpriced I would consider staying here...

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dani_1217
Reviews.Content: I was on a group trip so we were to stay in this hotel. The location is fantastic and that is the only nice thing I can say. Staff were rude and unfriendly, the management even worse. One of the maids decided to not look at what she was doing and did not look on the bed, and just grabbed all the sheets and ended up washing my cell phone - ruining it. Front desk staff were rude and the management was ok, the assistant manager tried to help me and also offered me a phone call home if I needed (felt as if it was my one phone call) the general manager could not even get out of his office to speak to me. The rooms are located on the main street so sleep is not an option, there was no alarm clock and the piping was coming out of the bathroom wall. The restaurant is a big room with tables, nothing you would call a restaurant, more like a cafeteria. This hotel will only get their customers because of location. A few people on my trip were stuck in the elevators a few times during our stay. Pool looked dirty. You truly see the difference between a 2 star hotel which is what I would rate this hotel and anything higher.

Reviews.Title: “Have already recommended it to 2 other people; we'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: clamc40
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the Skyline. I have recommended it to 2 others already. Were travelling with an extended family group, with kids around 12-15 years old. The positives far outweighed the negatives, but FYI in the interest of a balanced review, the NEGATIVES were: - incoming parking process was slightly confusing - older hotel so showing its age in some ways - depending on your perspective, the hotel was "too far" from the busy excitement of Times Square - though I though the 12-15 min walk to Times Square was no problem at all, and I liked being slightly away from all the lights/craziness/action - not enough plugs in room (pet peeve of mine) - while internet rate was reasonable, had to buy separately for each device ($10/day tho I bought a package for $35 for 5 days)- this is an expensive inconvenience if you want internet on your computer as well as your smart phone, etc. - small lobby so if many people are checking in/out at same time it is crowded - this did NOT bother any of us but it could bother others - the streets you take to walk to/from stuff aren't very nice - they aren't terrible, but they aren't overly pretty either - no coffee maker or microwave in room - pool itself was no big deal and the hours were limited POSITIVES - clean beds / clean rooms, bathrooms, and carpets - our room (Deluxe Queen) was quite large - large by most hotel standards and enormous by NYC standards - View from the rooftop pool, especially at night, was excellent - fridge in room - $10/day parking - Outgoing parking was smooth as silk (vs. Incoming confusion). - Price is very reasonable (for a centrally located, decent hotel, family-friendly, in the middle of Manhattan) - - big windows in room with dusted window sills - working A/C - needed it, it was so hot during our July visit - quiet (though we were really only there for enough time to sleep a bit) - I thought the location was excellent. Easy to find from the Lincoln Tunnel. One block east to 9th Avenue took you to the central Hell's Kitchen area where there are loads of restaurants open at all hours day and night. 12-15 mins walk to Times Square. Subway about 5-10 mins walk. - across the street from hotel was the Skyline Deli (open 24 hours) sold cereal, milk, juice, fruit, toasted bagels, convenience stuff, etc ... Was handy for breakie or late night snack. Hotel had a restaurant but we didn't eat there. Breakfast seemed cheap enough though. Internet stations in lobby floor so there are those too if you don't need it in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Redheadedyooper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel one night before we were to leave on our cruise. This hotel was perfect for what we were looking for being first time NYC visitors. We took a cab from the airport to the hotel and then walked the rest of the time. We walked to Times Square and Central Park and the hotel was very conveniently located just a few blocks from the cruise ship terminal so we walked there to board our cruise (if you can handle walking with your luggage, you can walk this short distance). There are several restaurants in the vicinity and plenty of variety too! We enjoyed our stay. We were in the renovated side of the building so everything was fairly up to date. The room was average sized and the beds were comfortable. The price was more than we were used to paying, but I guess not too bad for NYC. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Pendreich1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Hells Kitchen District, we found it a great location 25 min walk to Central Park ,5th Ave. 15 mins to Times Square. Hundreds of restaurants on the door step, Deli's to die for. Unfortunetly didn't even get to see hotel bar and restaurant so can't comment on them but fab diner short walk away called " Galaxy" amazing breakfast, anything you could ever want and really cheap. For dinner go to "Uncle Mario's" just one block away (Italian) fantastic food, the lady manager is a real character. They do the best garlic and parmesan bread sticks and jugs of iced Sangria which was most welcome on a hot July night. Pool at hotel was good, very warm not lavish but more then adequate with the most amazing skyline view as you get out the lift. Staff very friendly . Lovely Art Deco hotel with lovely Quite, cool air cond, cosy places to sit. Loved it.........

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Passepartout56
Reviews.Content: Yes this hotel is in the Hell's Kitchen area but the area is much smarter than it used to be. We walked to and from the hotel at all times and not once did we feel unsafe. The hotel itself is terrific, large lobby/reception area. Wonderfully large rooms with everything you need for a stay in NYC. I wonder if some rooms have been renovated more recently which might explain the discrepancies in some reviews. Will definitely use again....indeed, its already booked!

Reviews.Title: “First time to NYC, would definitely return to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: buddynpal
Reviews.Content: We were on the 5th floor facing 10th Ave; double beds for 2 adults and 1 child (5 yrs old). After hearing the horror stories about NYC having small rooms I was surprised to find the Skyline had nice size rooms! It was easy to move around, bathroom was also a good size; yes the decor is older but it was in great condition. There should be no one complaining about the condition! Everything was clean from the rooms to the hallways and the lobby was nice also. People were friendly and helpful. The pool was nice and clean. We took adavantage of the transit system which was very close to the hotel. Walking from Times Square was not too far; we ALWAYS felt safe. A bakeshop on 49th was great (Donna Bells) and a Thai restaurant (Pam's) was also good. A hidden gem the Skyline!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Virgo_V
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many New York Hotels, the Skyline was one of the better ones. It was clean with good sized rooms and friendly, trusted staff (who were able to return my lost phone which I left in my room). The hotel also caters for those who are disabled, with extra space and disabled bathrooms (we were first put in one of these rooms and then changed rooms - but it was good to know they valued equality). Also, the car parking is very reasonably priced....,much cheaper than the parking spots around the city and other hotel's carparking charges. As it was a very short stay, I did not see the pool or gym so I cannot comment on this. I was too busy out and about! However, although the hotel is not in the heart of Times Square, it is close enough. And there are a number of food places i.e. Thai resturants around the hotel area to be enjoyed. Overall, I enjoyed my stay here and would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned, and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Harkensaw
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and myself stayed here on our first trip to New York. It is close to almost everything, and if not it's only a subway or taxi journey away. The room we had was spacious for our needs with a great skyline view. The housekeeping came every day while we were out. My only gripe would be that the Internet I paid for only lasted 2 days instead of 5 and the number I was given for customer services didn't seem to work. Other than that a smashing place. Hope to stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...amazing city!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ANGELUNDERCOVER
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Skyline hotel for 4 nights. From the moment that we checked in we were made to feel welcome. Our room was spacious with everything that we needed inc ironing board, iron, fridge and safe as well as a large wardrobe space and 2 sets of drawers. As we were too excited to sleep on arrival we decided to have a walk to Times square, this was only a short 5 minute walk and even though it was 10.30 at night the neighbourhood felt safe and with most shops being open it felt more like the middle of the day! On our first full day we were still far too excited to sleep and decided to check out the gym and pool. The gym was well equiped with towels and water etc and the pool even though a little dated was just what we needed. The opening hours are a little limited, however, if you're in New York you'll be spending a short amount of time in the hotel anyway! On our first venture out we had decided that we would visit ground zero and asked a member of staff what would be the best way to get there. The lady that helped us gave us a map and explained where to get onto the subway and what number we would need for there and back and also explained about the metro card (a must and very reasonably priced). On arriving back at the hotel our room was spotless with clean sheets towels and anything else that had been used inc cups, tissues etc. On our final day at the hotel we didn't have to check out until 12 which was useful however our flight home wasn't until 11pm, this wasn't a problem as our bags were stored in a locked room and we were charged a dollar a bag (nothing for piece of mind when you've shopped NY out!) All in all a very pleasant hotel with lovely staff and when returning to New York we will definitely be staying here again!! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “great staff shame about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolLou_10
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel after studying reviews on trip advisor and disagree strongly with the majority of those reviews. The hotel is in Hells kitchen not the Theatre district, we felt unsafe after dark. The staff do their best, the bathroom was immaculate but the whole hotel needs urgent renovation. The swimming pool has great views but was unusable in my opinion due to rusty trim round the pool and dirty looking water. I would never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Minutes from Times Square for a fraction of the price!”
Reviews.Author: JustinConnors
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while attending the Future of Web Design conference. Our venue for the conference was literrally a half block away so it was a perfect destination. We arrived to the hotel via taxi from LGA. We are used to staying at marriotts wherever we go and the lobby really reminded me of one. We checked in and the front desk clerk was very friendly. They offered to take our bags to our room but we politely declined. When we entered our room it was very spacious for a nyc hotel room. I was really surprised with that. It seemed freshly renovated and it had a beautiful view of the NYC skyline. (hence the name haha) We went out exploring the city and found that we were literally a 5-10 minute walk from times square and all the broadway theatres. This was nice as it we wanted to go to a few broadways while in the city. Also we were only a few blocks from a subway station that could take us anywhere in Manhattan. I recommend getting the week subway pass as its only like 30 bucks and you can use it unlimited times. When we arrived back to the room there was complimentary wine and cookies/candy in our room with a birthday card from the hotel. They must have overheard me say to my wife something about my birthday being the day we checked in! it was an awesome surprise. We were not in the hotel much more throughout the week due to us being in NEW YORK but it was a great home base. Something that was awesome is that there is a 24 hour deli right across the street from the skyline that is nice when you need a snack late at night. Loved it and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing pool, great location”
Reviews.Author: EmmaAust
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel - it's difficult to find something so close to Times Square that isn't an expensive change or a run-down dive. It's a fairly basic hotel, but it's clean, has friendly staff, and has an amazinf rooftop pool. The pool is the feather in its cap - it's open late, has views over Times Square and Manhattan, and must be amazing on New Year's Eve. The rooms are comfortable, but lack anything but the most basic facilities. There's no fridge or coffeemaker, but there is a fantastic deli across the street, for cheap bagels and rolls. There is reasonably priced internet access in the lobby, and a parking garage attached (for a fee). It would be a reasonable place to stay if driving - it's not far from the Lincoln Tunnel. Bizarrely, as a couple, we were allocated a twin room, and when we went to reception to ask about a double, we were told it was more expensive. I haven't come across that before, so while I wouldn't recommend it for a honeymoon, it wasn't a major problem.

Reviews.Title: “average place to stay. location makes it.”
Reviews.Author: ems812
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the skyline hotel for 5 days as part of a package deal to new york. the trip was for my 30th birthday. On arrival we checked in, the receptionist wasn't interested and just did what was needed. she never directed us to our room and we were left to find it on our own. On the second day we noticed both bedside lights were not working so we went and reported it to reception, as i write this review, i am still waiting for it to be repaired!! Overall the hotel was clean and bed/towels were changed every day which was suprising but nice. I would return to the skyline but more because it was a great location to where we wanted to be (10 mins from times square).

Reviews.Title: “What a Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: baybeeblues
Reviews.Content: The room was large and newly renovated - the hotel service was fine - better than most in NYC and location worked out great so overall I'd definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Josie1985
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights before and 2 nights after my contiki trip because it was discounted through my contiki. I had to share with another girl from the trip but I didnt mind as it was discounted. The place is in Hells kitchen which is a walk away from Times Square. The concierge there was super friendly and helpful. She definatly knew her job. I am grateful for her help when asking about tourist attractions as she was knowledgeable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Actually had real queen beds”
Reviews.Author: UrsiB
Reviews.Content: It's very hard to find an inexpensive hotel in Manhatten that offers real queen beds. Most seem to offer full-size mattresses. This way two people can share a bed in reasonable comfort. The room was comfortable, clean and spacious, with a mini-fridge. We walked from the hotel directly to the theatre on the same street. Took about 10 minutes. There are tons of eating places in the area, as well as a drug store on the next block. Employees were very friendly and helpful. They were doing some work on the place, but nothing that got in the way. I rated it very good for these comforts and conveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, not the best of staff”
Reviews.Author: Cargo1987
Reviews.Content: We stayed here due to a problem with our booking in another hotel. Although it was a last minute change, we had a look and thought the Skyline would be a good place to stay. The hotel is situated in a great location, not far from alot of the big attractions and sites around New York. and a block or two away from a subway station. The Hotel is a little dated but is clean and that is the main thing. The room we stayed in was very noisy at night and you could here every car and truck that went past outside, which is not the best when you want a good nights sleep after a day of sight seeing and being on your feet all day. When we arrived we had trouble comunicating with the reception staff and the gentelman who dealt with us was not, or did not seem to be, very good at English and didn't understand anything i was asking or saying. To add to this, we had trouble making internation calls and decided on buying a phone card, as recommended by the hotel, and used it to phone the UK from the hotel. The staff at reception, after asking them if we would get charged for using it (we asked 3 TIMES!!!!) said we would not get charged except from the 75 cents connection fee. To my surprise, I was hit with a large bill at the end of our stay, over $20 as oppose to the $2.25 we expected and where told. I would not use this hotel again when I visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job.... But a very dull hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Solidsnake1986
Reviews.Content: I went to new york for my birthday with a few friends. Stayed there for 5nights... The first night we got there we was late because we had to travel all the way from newark airport which took ages... Lady at the desk said our room had been taken so she would upgrade us free of charge to the a bigger room for the night which i thought was good of them... The coincerage lady downstairs near the reception was very helpful her name was christy I think nice person and good looking ;).... The room we had the 2nd night was really bad... The plugs weren't safe looked like they were falling apart and very dangerous the window when opened was very wide so if have kids beware..... Was looking for my phone that night and lifted the mattress to see where it had gone.. Not only did I find my phone but also a used condom which was disgusting..... When using the shower the cold water would always come out first which made it difficult to twist the handle to make it medium hot because u can't dodge the water without the cold water hitting..... The security of the hotel is a joke I was walking in and out around 4am and didn't see any1 there to greet me... I could have been a tramp off the streets and I could have went up to any floor and they wouldn't have known... Rooms were very hot as well making us very restless some nights.... The only good about the hotel was the fact that a 24hour shop was open with the same name but better service... I think the hotel is decent but I did expect more especially,,,,,,,..

Reviews.Title: “priced right. great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: thehamoftruth
Reviews.Content: not much interaction with the staff. they were gracious enough to let us check in almost four hours early. clean room. never ate there. close to grocery stores and other amenities if you're there for a couple of days. easy walk to restaurant row. tiny bathroom but the sink, mirror and vanity are located outside so two people can easily maneuver. handy refrigerator in room. excellent choice if you don't plan on living in your hotel room. get a slice of pizza from fat sal's across the street. Long walk to F train. A & C, are closer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MrsWilliamsColumbia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is showing it's age but we enjoyed our stay. I liked the location of this hotel, midtown is convenient with lots of subway choices and only about 15 mins walk (in heels!!) to times square. For the price you can't beat it! Check in was smooth too. Lot's of places right across the street if you need a bottle of liquor or some snacks or a slice. We reserved a suite with the expectation of 3 people staying in the room. At the last minute 2 more friends decided to make the trip with us. I knew our maid found out eventually and was so cool about it and even bought extra pillows and towels for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Betty015
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Skyline from 18/5 to 23/5 and were very pleased with the hotel. The room was large, very clean, the beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was large and clean too. We had fresh towels every day and good maid service. The staff were really friendly and chatted to us, making us feel very welcome. The only criticism is that the room was hot and the air con was just a large fan which blew out cold air. The location of the hotel was perfect - 3 blocks down from Times Square, surrounded by little restaurants, bars, 24 hour deli opposite that served everything from cups of tea to lovely fresh fruit salads, open 24 hours a day. The outside road traffic was noisy but - hey - it is NY and when I have been before to another hotel and was up high, I could still hear road noise!! Overall, a good choice and I would be happy to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Girlfriends Retreat”
Reviews.Author: GoodfriendsBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed with six girlfriends - three in one room - - and four in a suite. There was plenty of room. Two queen size beds in one room and two king sized beds and a pull-out couch in the suite. The rooms were immaculate, the beds extremely comfortable, and it was close to the Theatre District, which is a first priority for us. We've stayed at other hotels closer to Times Square, and never had this much room to spread out. It also felt more like a neighborhood. Only one friend used the pool, but really enjoyed it. It wasn't one of those postage-stamp sized pools either. I'd definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for a good-sized room in a place not TOO far from attractions”
Reviews.Author: RabePaul
Reviews.Content: In New York City, location is everything. You can always "save" a ton of money by not staying on Manhattan, but then you will miss one of the main attractions of this city: its non-stop energy level. Spending an hour going to and from your lodging inevitably forces you to miss this facet of NYC. Skyline is not right at Manhattan's hot spots, but it's fairly close. Tenth Avenue (on the west side) at 49th Street (mid-town) is only "near" the Javits Convention Center, but not terribly far from Times Square and the Theater District. A subway is two "long" blocks away, a bus line goes right by the hotel, and one could even walk to Times Square. The general area is not bustling with people all day, but there are a number of delis, bars, and place to hang out. Thus, unless you need to be right AT a certain place, a substantial price savings may well make this place a bargain for its location. In addition, the room we stayed at (#422) was quite roomy for NYC lodging. At the price we paid ($427 for two nights) we got a lot more space than we expect for lodging in this city. As the photo below shows, there was clear water damage on the ceiling of our bathroom. The staff seems to be aware of it, as they tried to paint over it. I have no idea if they did anything more than that. There was no musty smell or mildew in the bath, but it doesn't appear there were any major repairs done to handle this water problem. The room featured air conditioning, TV with 40 channels, iron, mini-fridge (useful for cold drinks), phone (charges even for toll-free calls) and shower. It was clean, comfortable, and well-maintained. The hotel has a 24 hour exercise room, as well as pool -- but check the hours on the latter. Staff was professional and courteous. Note that all smoking is completely forbidden in all places inside the hotel. No breakfast is provided for guests, and I did not notice a restaurant in the hotel itself. However, several delis, bars, and fast-food restaurants are within a block of the hotel, so you will have several choices of where to eat. I recommend the Ramses Deli across the street for fresh sandwiches. The hotel charges for parking (no surprise in NYC), for wi-fi on a 24-hour basis, for use of the PC in the lobby, and for storing luggage after you check out. The latter is no more than what you would tip the bell hop at any other place, so consider it a mandatory tip.

Reviews.Title: “Not the highlight of our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: rob21blue
Reviews.Content: We went to New York for our honeymoon & I can safely say that the Skyline hotel was certainly not the highlight. Staff were rude, hotel looked old & tired and the location was not inviting. The maid also did not understand that we did not need our room cleaning from the Do Not Disturb sign & just went ahead anyway & left it on the floor. The only positive thing I can say is that the hotel was clean but that's it. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Locations”
Reviews.Author: CharandMatt
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with a perfect location. The hotel was just a few blocks and a short walk from Times Square, lots of little deli's and restaurants nearby and only a couple of blocks from the metro stop which takes you all the way down to the world trade center site, with stops at penn station and spring street for Soho shopping along the way - nice and easy to navigate. It's just an all round superb location. The hotel itself is a little dated in decor etc but very clean, housekeeping did a great job every day, clean towels, clean bedding. We didn't eat in the restaurant or use the pool so can't comment on those - mainly because we wanted to explore and go out to eat and just didn't get the time to use the pool as we had such a jam-packed 5days with tons of sightseeing and shopping to do. We've stayed at the skyline before (about 5 years ago) so knew how good the location was already and knew the hotel was decent the last time we stayed and we weren't disappointed. If you're expecting luxury you will be disappointed but it's basic, clean and has super friendly staff (except one misery guts we encountered!). A great base to sleep, get changed and store your shopping during your stay. There's so much to do and see in New York, how much time do you really spend in your hotel....??! Would definitely recommend to anyone wanting a decent priced hotel, clean and with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: BigDave055
Reviews.Content: Hotel was within easy walking distance from times square and was clean and tidy. Our room must have been near some air conditioning motor as it was a little noisy untill it went off which was about 11pm at night it cam on about 6:30 in the norning so if you were a light sleeper this could be a problem if you layed in in the morning. There was a fridge in the room which was handy if you brought food back with you and wished to keep it for the next day. Room was always kept clean and the towels were change every day as were the bed clothes. Staff were polite and always helpful, if you asked me would I stay there again then the answer would be yes as it was a cheap budget hotel and in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “The Parking Garage(Primary Parking) at the Hotel ripped me off”
Reviews.Author: Epenn12
Reviews.Content: I called and got a quote for Parking for Saturday, May 7 to Sunday May 8 at 6:00 p.m. They told me $29.00. When I parked the car, i asked the attendant the price. He said $29.00 for the time period. I got back on Sunday afternoon they charged me $52 and they would not charege it. They jsut pinted at the web site for the company Primary Parking. When I went there It didn't exist!! DO not park in this lot they will rip you off!!!!

Reviews.Title: “not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Brown-mr
Reviews.Content: We expected a lot more than we got, The lobby was very impressive and clean, Receptionist was "as it says on the tin" a receptionist. then the lift, ok upto the 4th floor. ok now the room...... The Room was, If I were to say poor I would be generous. I couldn,t see where any refurhishment had taken place, the carpet was damp and it smelt of disinfectant. But the worst part of the hotel was the POOL. Very nice to be swimming in the penthouse with lovely views, but the water was very warm and almost cloudy. you would be wise not to swim for fear of legionnaire's desease.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: pterkies
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay at this hotel. The lobby is beautiful and Rooms are fabulous. Indoor pool was great. Thanks to the hotel manager Tara. She was extremely friendly and helpful. Thank you for making our stay memorable. we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CDD121
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited NYC in January and were initially looking to stay outside the city and use one of the trains as recommended by most everyone we talked to. However, after looking at prices I found that the Skyline Hotel was comparable to those in New Jersey and was conveniently located in Midtown Manhattan just a few blocks from the Lincoln Tunnel and even fewer blocks from Times Square. The location made for an easy entry into the city without having to fight thru the congestion just a few blocks away. The hotel itself is a throwback to the past from the lobby to the hallways. I don't mean this in a bad way, it seems like one of the "fancy" hotels from old-time movies, very retro-high-class. The rooms themselves are spacious, as was verified by our 18-month old who had plenty of room to run around and play. While the hotel itself reminds you of something from a time gone by, the rooms have all the modern conveniences like LCD TV's, fridges, and comfortable beds to make the stay enjoyable. The only negative thing I would say about the rooms is that the drywall could use a little patching in places (like the areas around the heating/AC units) as they are crumbling away. However, I could not hear a sound from other rooms so I just tended to ignore surface appearances. The wait staff in the restaurant area were among the most friendly I have ever encountered and went out of their way to make our breakfasts (the only meal we ate in the hotel) fantastic. The price is great and the location couldn't be much better without going into sky-high costs. A ten minute walk thru a very safe-feeling residential area gets you into the heart of Times Square. Yet those few blocks mean all the difference in terms of price, and also activity level since I don't want to be disturbed by outside noises in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it - perfect with a POOL!”
Reviews.Author: SCATCAT53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Skyline Hotel for 5 nights in April 2011 and had a most enjoyable stay. Our room was lovely, very clean, and quiet. The pool on the penthouse level was a real bonus, just what you need to start off the day - a refreshing dip before breakfast and before walking the streets of New York, - and just what you need at the end of the day to unwind and relax after miles of walking streets of New York!! The gym was well equiped - but we were too exhausted to use it! Location of the hotel was ideal, plenty of small bars and places to eat just a block away, and not too far from main tourist attractions, Times Square, Broadway etc. The Skyline Deli on opposite street corner is open 24hrs - they make a great breakfast takeaway menu - perfect to eat in bed if you dont want to go out for breakfast!! would recomend this hotel to anyone going to New York and would stay here again should we ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for wonderful NYC”
Reviews.Author: TheRigbys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 2 children ages 8 and 13 yrs for 5 nights. Great location only ten mins walk to Times Square. Few blocks from Empire state building. Close to restaurants n shops and 5 mins from circle line cruises to see statue of liberty. Room decent size and clean and made up every day with clean towels.No complaints about room or hotel. Not the poshest but certainly does the job. Pool nice for the children to chill also after busy day. Restaurant looked fine but we didnt use as it was nice to walk for donuts and coffee in a morning!! Top of the rock is a must and if you get a ticket for daytime you can keep this and just pay 10 dollars extra to return at night to see night time view also. You dont have to do this on the same day !!! Well worth doing !! We did 2 hour circle line cruise which was great- really informative and funny commentary and takes you right past statue of liberty.Well worth getting the city pass as covers lots of attractions and saved us a fortune. Also you have a seperate queue so it saves time xx Central park is lovely and the horse drawn carriage round is a lovely way to get your bearings !! Its 50 dollars for 20 minutes- not cheap but you have to !!! we would certainly stay there again as a good value base for nyc !!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Duk1
Reviews.Content: The Skyline Hotel has a lot going for it. Its in a good location for the Times Square/Broadway/7th Avenue area (about 10 minutes walk away). Excellent service by the staff Pleasant, clean rooms A swiming pool (only opens early mornings and evenings) The local area on 9th and 10th Avenues has a lot of bars, restaurants, delis and takeaways to cater for most tastes and pockets. The local area seems safe, but slightly scruffy. So make sure you check Google street view before you book then you have an idea of what its like nearby. To keep the costs down we went for the smallest twin rooms. Overall, these were bettter than I expected and at the back of the hotel (so less traffic noise), but the thin walls meant we could hear the nearby lifts (this was a minor problem for us)

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location, could use a little TLC”
Reviews.Author: worldtrvlr8
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice in the past year. The first time, the room was large and very pleasantly updated. The second and more recent time, the room was large but somewhat tired, especially the bathroom. The staff is extremely helpful and the $10 parking is an extraordinary value for guests who are driving into the city. The location is very good. Times Square is about a 15-minute walk. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms have small refrigerators. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel and I'd stay here again, but I'd be sure to ask for a recently renovated room. For more than two people in a room, there's very decent space, especially by New York-hotel room standards.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: drmadcap
Reviews.Content: Hotel was at a great location, a couple blocks off Broadway/Times Square. The rooms were very clean, reasonably spacious, had a nice TV, maids visited daily, fitness centre, swimming pool, offers buffet breakfast, very comfortable beds and a fridge in the room. Only negatives were seemingly thin walls and you had to pay for WiFi Area wasn't the greatest, but there is an array of takeaways on the same road (Chipotle Mexican Grill and Foo King chinese takeaway recommended) and a laundromat next door

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ttshortee
Reviews.Content: Myself and 5 other friends stayed at this hotel in November 2010 I was abit nervous as I had booked the hotel before reading reviews but anyway . We had 2 rooms 3 sharing in each the as we arrived we where welcomed with a smile so that was a start we where meet by the bell boy who put our bags in the lift for us. The hallways where abit old fashioned so I was starting to get rather nervous but as I opened the room I was rather surprised the room was a very nice size with 2 double beds desk tv storage cupboard to put ur bags . The only thing was the bathroom was on the small side but a plus side was the vanity station was outside but not all rooms are like that as our other room had the mirror and sink inside with the bath and toilet. Our main purpose was to go shopping in time square etc it was a 10min max walk and about 5min to the nearest subway so the location wasnt as bad as a thought the only down side is a few times we had to get a cab bk due to the fact we had to many shopping bags !

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality for the Price”
Reviews.Author: niboo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night in a queen deluxe room on the advice of a friend who has stayed several times. The location feels kind of 'out there' but it's also very close to tourist attractions and more restaurants than you can count. The lobby is very clean and the desk staff was very helpful getting us into our room hours prior to the formal check in. The room was spotless and the beds were comfortable with very comfortable pillows as well. The view from our room overlooked an Amtrack railroad track, luckily it was not disruptive. We only heard the train (which goes right under the hotel) a few times and not late at night. Walls were somewhat thin, I could hear the people either on the side or above us opening their curtains. There is an indoor pool but it is closed for the bulk of the afternoon. I think there is also a fitness room which we did not use. There is a concierge in the lobby, several computers and several TVs in a common area. We didn't drive, but there is very cheap valet parking ($10 per day I think) but you have to leave your car parked for your entire stay. I would definitely stay here again and was very impressed with the cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Aranawes
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at the Skyline and found all aspects of the hotel to be excellent. The rroms were spacious and nicely appointed, the staff were very friendly and helpful and the location is perfect - especially if you use the preferred mode of seeing New York by walking. There are convenient restaurants/diners nearby offering reasonable meals as well as some small grocery and convenience stores that are a plus.My room faced onto 10th, but was very quiet and had blackout curtains to keep the daylight at bay. The windows also opened which is a nice feature. Now the rooms are not appointed like the Plaza, but they are more than adequate - think of a Best Western/Comfort Inn prioperty located in midtown. In addition to the above parking is available at $10 at the adjacent indoor parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Honey for the Money”
Reviews.Author: rubymrv
Reviews.Content: We just spent the weekend in NYC and stayed at the Skyline. There were five of us and we wanted to be near the Art Expo, so the location was perfect and we needed a big room. I did research on line and found the Skyline to have the best price for the group of us. The room was very clean and large. Also, the onsite parking for $10 a night was a bonus. The only negative was our view of the back side of another building that was in rough shape. Other than that, it was a honey for the money. And although they don't advertise if they give a discount for AAA members, I did get a discount when I asked at the desk. The kids were VERY disappointed at the pool hours: 7-9 am then closed till noon. WHY? That doesn't make any sense at all and we never got to swim.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for us”
Reviews.Author: Rube109
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here at the beginning of March & found it to be a very nice hotel. It was just a short distance away from Central Park & Times Square. Our room was warm, spacious & very clean & the staff were all friendly & polite, especially the concierge. If we ever return to New York, we would most certainly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: catibbs
Reviews.Content: I returned yesterday from a 3 night stay at the Skyline Hotel. The rooms were clean with no signs of bed bugs! It's about a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square. It's a pretty quiet area to stay in and we (2 women) felt safe in the area. At night, I would recommend taking a taxi back to the hotel for safety. The breakfast buffet was okay...it was around $14/person. We only did the buffet once and found that we enjoyed breakfast at the local restaraunts more for the same price. Overall, it was a great stay with no problems and I would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Generally a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: brimel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Skyline for a single night, and would stay there again. There were only 2 things that I would complain about: there is a fee for Internet service, and the HVAC unit in our room didn't work properly. We woke up in the middle of the night quite warm, with no way to cool the room down. Had we stayed another night, we would have requested another rooom. The beds were very comfortable, the toiletries were great, the shower powerful and high ehough for a 6'+ person. We did not eat at the on-site restaurant. Parking is available for $10/day , a real steal in NYC. Two blocks to the subway and an easy walk to Times Square, so the location is quite convenient. All in all, a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: cgulka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Skyline before and after taking a cruise from the nearby cruise terminal. Before the cruise, we had a room in the older section of the hotel with two double beds. That room was VERY small, and a bit run down, but good enough considering the price, and the fact that we were in Manhattan. The second stay, after the cruise was in a room with two queen beds. The room was MUCH nicer and in a newer part of the hotel. There was a problem however with low water pressure in the shower however. The location is pretty good too, just a 5-10 minute walk from just about anything.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: shannondor
Reviews.Content: We visited The Skyline in Oct 2010. 3 girls looking for a cheap, basic, but not nasty hotel! The Skyline met our needs in terms of the budget - very reasonable price! The hotel was great, friendly staff (although didn't see too much of them!) Very big rooms, 3 girls in NYC with room to spare seems like a miracle! The location was great, 5-10 mins walk from Times Square, easy walk to Central Park, Subway stop easy to find a couple of blocks from hotel. Restaurants nearby too! This hotel is by no means luxury, but if you are looking for a clean, spacious place to rest your head, and want to get the most out of your money then this is the perfect place to go! We would defintely return here next time in NY! Only bad point is I think my bed had bed bugs as I woke up with a couple of bites, my two friends were sharing the other bed and they were fine!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: traveller143-11
Reviews.Content: This place was great for our weekend stay with the kids. The valet out front was helpful with our car. The front desk service was really nice. I've stayed in a lot of NYC hotels and The room was so much better than I expected. Complimentary room amenities, very clean and nice bathroom. Overall it was a great experience - everyone was very nice here. The manager Dana was super helpful and made our weekend with teenagers very eventful. Her knowledge and suggestions were a hit with the whole family! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sky is the limit with Skyline!!”
Reviews.Author: Hersheys-NYC
Reviews.Content: This trip was a father & son getaway, his 16th birthday treat. Having read so many reviews on trip advisor, i found that, it really is an individual opinion. Some of us have expectations far higher than reality. So i felt obliged to write one about this trip to New York City, albeit this being my first review. Just recently, i and a few friends stayed at the Bellagio Hotel in Vegas, so my first thought was the comparison that i was going to make when i got to the Skyline. Yes, there is a difference. Having said that though, the Skyline was better in their room size (2 x double bed 4th floor) Clean room/clean towels/comfortable living area. Maid came everyday to make beds and change towels/hoover etc..... Checking in at the hotel was efficient and ALL the staff was exceptional. Hot drinks was available in the lobby area throughout the day. When we was exploring the hotel, at no stage did we say "this is not good". Skyline had a gym room also a swimming pool, and comments were made on trip advisor that the hours of the pool was not enough......? what are these people thinking....... "right when i get to Skyline im going to swim solid for 6 hours and do another 3 hours before i go to bed"! Get a grip. Let's move on, it's around a 10min walk to Times Sq and at no time did we feel unsafe walking back to the hotel late at night. Plenty of places to eat on 10/9th Avenue whatever your choice of food maybe. Two blocks down on the corner of 10th Av & 52st was City Lights Diner, fantastic there. Here's some free advice: If you need to make phone calls back home, then get yourself to the "Radioshack Store" 8th Av Port Authority, i got a Virgin pay as u go for $20 top it up with credit and they will activate your phone there & then, within 20mins i was phoning back UK for 40cents per minute! Also if you want to go Statue of Liberty "Crown Access" book online asap with Statuecruises.com like i did. When we got there all crown tickets we're sold out! Beware it's a very stiff climb but worth it. Go Empire State Building and buy the 86th & 102 Floor tickets then you do not need to go "Top of the Rock". Lastly, make sure you have an itinerary, as we stayed there for 9 nights we divided our days with North/South/East & West sight seeing. One more thing, if shopping is your thing, do what we did. Go with old clothes and trash them out there and get yourself to the "Woodbury Outlet Centre" it's easier to book it with your Concierge around $42 per person but you do get a discount booklet coupon. Kuwait Airlines are cheap and you get to have 2 x suitcases @ 23kgs and hand luggage @ 8kgs, Bargain! I hope this review really helps you guys out, Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel nice price”
Reviews.Author: cj281
Reviews.Content: if you don't mind staying a few blocks from times square - this is a great place at a very reasonable rate. They also have an unbeatable rate for parking - $10/day. I've stayed here a of couple times and this last time we stayed in a recently refrubished immaculate good size room. The pool is only open a couple of hours in the early AM and then I think again at night - but it was great and the water is close to 90! Staff was pleasant - in my 3 stays here some of the folks at the front desk were the same. Just remember to bring your own coffee - they do not have it in the rooms - but for what you save on parking - you can buy a lot of coffee! Not alot of frills here - just a good hotel with a good price

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Tatiana016
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked very nice in the brochure, and we had choosen it because of its rooftop swimming pool. The rooms were okay but a little shabby looking! The swimming pool was nice but there were bars on the windows so the view wasn't that great at all ! In the brochure, they didn't show the bars! We also had an awful service in the cafe who was attached to the hotel. The first morning, we waiting 30 minutes to get a breakfast who wasn't the correct order! So we just ended up eating breakfast outside. The location was okay! Just by a pier.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise. If driving in to NYC hard to beat this one.”
Reviews.Author: jeffky68
Reviews.Content: We went up the Macy's parade and had found this hotel on line. The pictures do not do it justice at all. This a very nice hotel by NYC standards. Rooms are good size too. Only thing that I could say bad about the hotel is its about 5 blocks from Time Square and a few from the subway. There are some good place to eat in the area. As for safety always felt good walking around with my family. I have stayed at the Edison, The Comfort Inn on 35th, and The Belvedere. This was the best room without question just not the location. The pool is nice if you have kids the hours are just not good. The workout room was very nice. Cardio equipt is what i have at the gym in Louisville. Parking is crazy cheap for NYC, 10 a day. That is just a buy. I would stay again. Staff is very nice too. Each hotel I mentioned in this review have been nice and would not blink at going back to them. Each has its ups and downs. For the money this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Our granddaughters graduation trip not easily forgotten”
Reviews.Author: cmconni
Reviews.Content: We brought our teenage granddaughters on their graduation trip to see the sights, a Broadway show, and shopping on Canal Street. . They loved it and so did we. Our niece who comes to NYC quite often recommended it highly. We were very pleased with the location, the staff and the comfortable rooms. We got two rooms so everyone was happy. The breakfast was horrible. Don't miss the Il Melograno restaurant one block up - the best since we moved from Italy. All in all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “unclean and unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: JammyA
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay in October, attracted by the good reviews on tripadvisor. Outside the hotel looks awful, there is a dog biscuit jar and a "remove your skates" sign on the foyer desk...which was warning sign number one. The room was dirty, smelled terrible and there were stains on the toilet ceiling from the room upstairs. There was a pubic hair on the fridge door. We complained and were moved to a larger room which was for less able bodied people and was very dark and not very romantic. There was no room service. We checked out ASAP and moved to a much better hotel. The guy on the check-out was most unhelpful and when he asked why we did not want to stay I explained about the dirtiness of the rooms and lack of any room services, he just shrugged and asked me not to review it anywhere. I said where? - like tripadvisor! He did not even apologise. I have to say it has made me distrust some of the reviews on this site, particularly in regard to this hotel. The area is not great at all. Its not the sort of place you want to be returning to late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pterkies
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family. Great location. Rooms are spacious and clean. Hotel manager Tara was very friendly and helpful. Thank you Tara! We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but a great deal”
Reviews.Author: GingerTabby
Reviews.Content: When I'm visiting New York City I don't plan on spending a lot of time in my room. All I want is a quiet, comfortable, clean place to sleep and freshen up. If that's all you want, I recommend the Skyline. It's in a great location: just a few blocks from Times Square, Broadway theatres, and lots of great restaurants, but just far enough away from all the noise to ensure a decent night's sleep. The rooms are on the small side, but not uncomfortably so. If you've driven to the city, there's an adjoining parking garage available for $10 a day. There's a pool on the penthouse floor with some amazing views, but the water can be cold, so grab an extra towel. I haven't used the conceirge, but there is generally one available. My only complaint is that the adjoining restaurant never seems to be open, or perhaps may be closed permanently. All in all, a real deal of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Johngil
Reviews.Content: The hotel was older and noisy, but for the price we couldn't complain. The location was great, close to everything we wanted. Went to Wicked, which was a 20 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: Davids86
Reviews.Content: I was far from certain I'd picked a good choice when traveling back to NYC on business, but this hotel can certainly be recommended. Service is good, breakfast is plentiful and the location is also far from bad - it'll take you just a few minutes to get to Times Square and the subways by foot. Being Manhattan, the neighborhood appeared and was experienced as quiet/safe. Rooms were large with comfy beds and the pool on the top floor featured an amazing view of the New York Skyline, earning the hotel it's name "Skyline."

Reviews.Title: “Good but don't get room near the lift (#01/#02)”
Reviews.Author: Whitfield79
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Skyline Hotel, booked through Expedia for a good rate. Upon arrival were assigned room 401 & 402 adjacent to lift and emergency stairway exit. Although the beds were clean and comfortable and the room was adequate and regularly cleaned, the pillows were awful, ask for extras. We could hear the lifts going up and down although this stopped by 23.00 and started at 07.30. We did ask to move rooms but were told this would incur $20 fee per person per night. No compromise there. Dont bother having breakfdast in the hotel, go down a block to City Light Diner and have breakfast there. The beauty of this hotel is its location, far enough from Time square to be quiet with some great restaurants tucked around it. Its also easy to access all the main sites in minutes such as Central Park, Time Square, 5th Ave etc. Our only advice when booking would be check the room location. Its a good hotel, very functional with no added extras.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel/frustrating experience”
Reviews.Author: njflan
Reviews.Content: The hotel required a $40 hold on my credit card when checking in. It is now one month since my stay and I am still fighting to get that hold released from my account. The hotel placed a 6 month hold with an expiration date of May 2011 on my card!!!! They keep telling me that they cannot find a way of lifting the hold. Front desk staff hung up phone twice when I tried to inquire who I should talk too. Once I got through to Christine, the manager, she promised that the hold would be lifted immediately. It has now been one month!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lmarshall
Reviews.Content: It was a very charming old hotel. It was clean and pretty quiet! The staff was friendly and the concierge, Crystal was especially nice. It was a few blocks from the theater district, but it wasn't too far to walk. The restaurant is under construction, but they served a nice breakfast in the ballroom. Overall it was a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: starlight53
Reviews.Content: The staff of the Skyline Hotel at 725 10th Ave. are very courteous and helpful. They made our event so much easier. Everyone, including security were right there to help us. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Thank you staff of Skyline

Reviews.Title: “The Hospitality is Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: friebanks
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Skyline Hotel overnight after celebrating a very special birthday for my son and nephew. The staff extended themselves to our every need. When the celebration ended, I was able to go to my room and get a good nights sleep. The bed was comfortable and I can't wait to do this all over again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Ugly on the outside, decent on the inside, AC didn't work”
Reviews.Author: NachoTraveler
Reviews.Content: The outside of this hotel is not nice, you get out of the cab and say this is it? Rooms are decent but our AC didn't work and it was hard to sleep w/ out air. Also, the ticket booth inside the hotel is a rip off for show tix, so avoid. good location

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Kammy_Bear
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone going Newyork. The location was great not far from time square, the rooms are spacious with great views & ensuite and very comfortable beds. The Restraunt downstairs was great for morning breakfast as it was a buffet. They had a gym which was also great with a pool also located there. the staff were great. The concierge Kristin was the most friendly and helpful person i came across. she was always willing to help & go the extra mile. Overall, if you get the opputunity to go NY, thsi hotel is a must to stay at!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but overpriced even for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: sgswint
Reviews.Content: Good review led us here. It was clean and the staff friendly, but the decore and facilities are very dated. Had issues with the heating, which wuldn't switch off and the fridge (which was empty?)and sounded like it has a deisel generator unning it! To be fair to the staff they sorted it out no problem. Location is good, 3 blocks from Times square and we walked it every day and night. However, the Intercontinental times square was a $50 extra per night and a far superior hotel. i'd pay the extra if I went back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: val-7
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 5 friends on a 4 day christmas shopping trip. Rooms clean and a good size adequate for 3 adults 2 queen beds, beds/pillows very comfortable. Cleaned daily with clean towels, fridge in room and ice machine near by. Staff friendly and helpful. Great location for theatre and shopping, also good places to eat at reasonable prices on 9th ave. Try Druids (gastro type pub) straight opposite the hotel. It may be a little tired looking in a few area's but on a city break how much time do you spend looking at the decor of the hotel? All in all great value.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, nice people but very tired”
Reviews.Author: Siun
Reviews.Content: While the Skyline looks like a possible retro gem on some booking sites, it's more old motel style than retro. Room rates are low and it might work for you if you need a cheap, clean place for a visit to NYC but it's not convenient if you are trying to run around to midtown meetings. Reasonable food choices over on 9th avenue but the hotel is quite worn and looks like an older motel chain. The staff is lovely - very friendly and quite efficient. In both my room and my colleagues the heat was blasting and could not be shut off - the window barely opens and the noise level from 10th Avenue made a really restful sleep hard to come by.

Reviews.Title: “More than satisfied”
Reviews.Author: brooklynlady45
Reviews.Content: I was responsible for arranging overnight accommodations for our Nursing School Reunion and chose the Skyline Hotel. I was very happy with the Hotels location- walking distance to the Theater District, Restaurant Row, the Actor's Chapel, and other smaller eateries and deli's. There is parking at the Hotel for an unusually good rate. I shared a room with two queen sized beds with a colleague and we were very satisfied with the accommodations. The room and bathroom were very clean and up to date. The mattresses were extremely comfortable. I slept very well. I do hope that the on-site restaurant and lounge will be opened again soon and that the lobby & outside renovations will be completed and then the place will be perfect. Nevertheless, this is a real find in mid-town Manhattan and I will be staying there again in January with another group of friends from upstate NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Marie45
Reviews.Content: The Skyline Hotel is great for location and cleanliness. Rooms were big and kept clean every day from housekeeping. All the staff were great....very friendly and very helpful. The location was fantastic...5 minute walk from Times Square. New York people are very friendly and the shopping is great. I would like to thank all the staff at the Skyline Hotel for helping to make my holiday a good one especially Kristin who was always on hand to help organise trips, shows etc..and Joe. I would certainly recommend this hotel as a place to stay while in New York..Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located+better than expected=great hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: theflyingcrane
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for all NYC attractions...away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Friendly staff, clean rooms and hallways. Delightful housekeepers. This place was a joy to return to each night. It's not top of the line, but for the price it's better than expected. Try to get a room overlooking 10th Ave. The view of the skyline is fabulous. Try the 49 South restaurant just 1/2 block east on 49th St and the little shop on the corner of 10th and 50th for breakfast sandwiches and HOT HOT coffee. You can't go wrong staying at the Skyline. Warning: the internet service, supplied by Emenities, not the hotel, is severely lacking.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: FlyboyC
Reviews.Content: First of all, you are going to NY City. So adjust your expectations. I have been there 3 times, and this hotel was far mor spacious than the first two, and that for less money. We had the superior room - so all my comments are only valid for this room category (people hardly ever mention which room type they had, so kind of hard to compare). Our superior room had 2 queen beds plus an entrance with wardrobe and even two desks with a chair each. There was also a cupboard with a flatscreen TV on top. You can see, size of the room was spacious compared to the usually tiny rooms in Manhattan. Bath with tub was also comfortable size and in good overall shape. The much criticised hotel staff had an okay attitude - no rudeness or other misbehaviour. So if this has kept you from this hotel from other reviews, ask yourself if you really need them to be your friend, or are you just looking for accomodation with minimal service? If you need friendly stuff, then you're simply looking in the wrong price category. Overall: Definitely recommend the hotel, but check the price you are paying. We were quoted prices from 145 up to 287 per night for the superior double. The lower price represents excellent value for your money, whilst for anything over 200 you'll probably find better value. Negatives: The heating system really isn't working well. It didn't work when we arrived, so I called (twice) to get it fixed within one hour. Afterwards, it could just not be turned down. Once we turned it off, it didn't work when turning it on again. Also, when working, expect some crackling noises for some time. So the choice is either it is rather warm, or rather cold (both are in reasonable range). If you are not planning to spend much time in the room, that shouldn't be a problem. It's not like you would be freezing when it is off, and you can always have the window open to reduce heat (can be noisy though). Parts of the room are in very good shape, others not so much. In our room, the bathroom door wouldn't close perfectly, same goes for the main door. But both closed sufficiently to feel safe. Walking distance to times square is 12minutes (check with google maps if you don't believe). Nearest subway station is about 8 minutes (50.Street; which allows you to take subway line E directly towards JFK with interchange to the airtrain, total cost 7$ per person, taking around 1 hour - very competitive when traffic is slow (and it often is in Manhattan)). Overall we would definitely stay there again for a good price. If you are particularly picky on minor issues, pay more and go smoewhere else. If you are just a little bit easy about things not being perfect, this could be a good choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “About 15 mins by walk and $5 by taxi to Times Square.”
Reviews.Author: MaheshTravelTips
Reviews.Content: The location of hotel is good but if you are having children and are a frequent visitor to the Times Square, Macy's , Broadway shows or Empire state then you might have to walk good amount every day. If you are considering to use the hotel just to spend the night it is better to choose one that is near (and if you get cheap!) the limelight. But on a standalone basis, the rooms were good and cleanliness was maintained. Dunkin Donuts is a block away. Citysight hop-on hop off to Uptown tour starts 2 avenues away (10 mins walk) and Downtour starts 4 avenues away (15-20 mins walk). Macy is about 30 mins walk. I asked the staff to extend late check-out but they refused even thought the room was not occupied. The concierge charge about $1 per bag to secure the luggage on 24 hour basis. Overall not so excited, would find a better place to stay on next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Crystal is SUPER-AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: KNS_10
Reviews.Content: We booked the Skyline Hotel not really knowing where it was (not having visited NY before) and were delighted to find that it is pretty much in the perfect location - 10 minute to Central Park, 5 minute to Times Square, all the main attractions are within walking distance. But the BEST thing about our stay at the Skyline was Crystal C the concierge. She basically organised our whole trip for us - we presented her with a list of what we wanted to do during our trip on the first day and she sorted it all out - from advising us on when to do certain things, where best to go, organising tickets for everything and recommending really good restaurants and clubs. She is a mine of information about the locality and NY in general - right down to recommending the perfect place for us to buy our Hallowe'en outfits!!! Crystal makes the Skyline the perfect New York hotel!! Karen and Shelly

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value if using Travelocity's Secret Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend found this hotel through Travelocity's secret hotels. If you search for hotels in midtown with a pool, more than likely it will be the Skyline as very few hotels in Manhattan have pools. Hotel was fine, room was a good size, clean and comfortable. Don't expect a view as there isn't one. Hotel is a few blocks from Time Square so very convenient. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “great location for the cost”
Reviews.Author: claredb
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel in nov 2010 with a friend, we were celebrating our impending 30th birthdays and wanted somewhere resonably cheap to explore NY. we found the location great and could walk into times square in 7-8 mins. we also went to see 'wicked' at the gershwin theatre and i managed the walk in heels took about 5 mins. the hotel itself was basic but had everything we needed, 2 single beds, a tv , toilet, washbasin and shower. the view wasnt great overlooking the rooftops of the building next door. we were unlucky enough to be next to the lifts and could hear them beeping all through the night, we could also hear doors banging downstairs, so wasnt a quiet hotel. i would recommend that you put the 'do not disturb' sign on the door at night as twice we were woken by the maid at around 8am.we didnt use the pool or the resturant but found a few great delis for breakfast on the way to midtown. overall we felt safe in this hotel and for the price we payed couldnt really grumble

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dblosole
Reviews.Content: Booked a three day trip with a friend through Travelocity Top Secret and didn't know what hotel it was until it was booked. It happened to be Skyline Hotel and I was very pleased with the reviews prior to our arrival. The location was great, just a few blocks from Times Square and only one block from a multitude of restaurants on 9th Avenue. The room was average and the decor needed some updating, however the beds were comfortable. There was a fridge and safe in the room which was convenient. Enjoyed a good Chinese dinner at Mee on 9th Avenue I believe at the corner of 53rd st. Took a look at the pool and took some pictures of the city at night from there, but was too busy to use it as there is just to much to do.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service at the Skyline Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CindeeK57
Reviews.Content: I book rooms for staff in my organization at the Skyline Hotel and have always found Celeste and Natlhaya to be exceptional.
