They are both professional, courteous and go the extra mile to make sure you're reservations are correct and your every need is met. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting the NY area. Remember to ask for Celeste or Natlhaya when you call and you can be assured you're stay will be wonderful! Cindee Kiebzak

Reviews.Title: “Great for a big family”
Reviews.Author: Enemalm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in October. We got a junior suit including one room with two doublebeds and another room with a queen bedsofa. It was real spatious and great for a family of five. On the topfloor there is a pool with a nice skyline-view. The children used it everyday after a long day in the city. Another good thing is the location. Within 20 minutes walk you'll reach Central Park, Rockefelle center and Times Square. However, this is not a five-star-hotel. The staff was just OK, and parts of the hotel needs to be renovated, but we can recommened it.

Reviews.Title: “i had a great experience during my stay”
Reviews.Author: kikikay80
Reviews.Content: I just want say that my stay at Skyline was enjoyable, i was comfortable which made my days even better. The service was great and Tara at the desk is exceptional, she made me and my friends feel at home and she is extremely friendly. I will not only stay at the skyline during future trips but i will also recommend the hotel to family and friends. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible front-desk, rooms with odors, restaurant closed after noontime”
Reviews.Author: pibarreche
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel. Front desk is rude, restaurant is under renovations so it is closed after breakfast while no vending machine is to be found on site. Room is not really clean given that it smells. Heating was not working on the first night. Not recommended.,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Staff made the difference here..Thanks to Tara”
Reviews.Author: syk013
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, Close to broadway and time square. Amazing staff. Services were amazing. Specially Tara, She went out of her way to help us, very professional, very friendly, very nice. She knows how to take great care of their guests. Even though this Hotel was sold out and we had to go to another hotel for one night, we came back because of the services. Rooms were clean and spacious. I'd choose to stay there again anytime...

Reviews.Title: “ok if u juse use it for a base”
Reviews.Author: smooby
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my friend,on the internet it said it had a bar and resturant,was told on arrival the resturant was being modernised and they were only open for breakfast which was overpriced who wants to eat ham and cheese slices etc for breakfast. couldnt believe there was no tea/coffee in the rooms so we took our own kettle.so we ate/drank out all the time. would recomend getting the 3 day hop on bus pass well worth the money. congeirge very helpful apart from when we booked the return to the airport was told that we would be on the bus for 2hrs in fact we were last pick up it took a hr,we could of spent that time in times square rather than hanging around in the airport.

Reviews.Title: “London firefighters stay in New Yorks most ironic hotel name.”
Reviews.Author: jellypants82
Reviews.Content: First impressions: slightly surprised there were only 5 or 6 floors, considering the name of the hotel! We came over from London to participate in the Tunnel to Towers run, and pay our respects to 343. After half an hour of confusion at reception as to how many of us there were, we eventually moved into our rooms. The rooms were ok, and the staff gladly put an extra bed up for us due to the confusion. I'm told the food was also very good. ( I didnt make breakfast! ) I must say all the staff were superb, apart from one. Joe the bell boy, clearly upset for some reason unbeknown to us, took his anger out on us by virtually accusing us of attempting to break into the baggage store room. True, we went to get our own bags on departure, but only because the bell boy was nowhere to be seen. And we did have a plane to catch. An uncomfortable and embarrassing argument took place between Joe the bell boy, and one of our guys, the Governor (Chief). We did not expect to be spoken to in this way. Joe, be proffesional and deal with your own grievances in your own time. We had a nice tip waiting for you, but the cab driver didn't complain. All in all, it did a job, and provided us with somewhere to lay our drunken heads. But next time we will go up town, as the Skyline is a cab ride, especially in the early hours.

Reviews.Title: “ok as long as you dont stay in too long”
Reviews.Author: charlieballingall
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there was no one to help us, when we went to our room the room smelt musty and the carpet was damp. Later in the visit I discovered they had a flood and most people were taken to different hotels but not us. Not too pleased. There seemed no one to help us when we needed it. The maid even walked in on us without knocking!!! The only good thing was it was near Time Square which is the place to be to take you everwhere. I would also recommend walking to Time Square and buying the 3 day pass on th Cityscene tour bus, also gets up on the statue of Liberty Island and the Empire state building as well as other things, great value for money. You can hop on and off the buss

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else this place is a sh!t h0le”
Reviews.Author: skyviewsucks
Reviews.Content: checked in @ 3:00 and drop my bags off in the room then went to get something to eat while i waited for my wife to finish her business meeting. I returned to the hotel with the Mrs. and she didn't even make it to the room and said she couldn't stay in this hotel (the smells of cleaning chemicals or bug spray) she had a allergic reaction to something in the hotel almost immediately , also the room was dirty the bed was broken. when we went to the front desk to check out they told us that since we booked with online Expedia would handle the refund. to date Expedia has asked the skyline hotel if they would refund and they answer was no, they claim bed was used, (it was not) so Expedia will not give a refund! instead we stayed @ the Intercontinental near Times Square $329+taxes stay away from the Skyline Hotel

Reviews.Title: “A lovely friendly and clean hotel with very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: MarieB11
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a lovely weeks stay at this hotel cannot fault it. The swimming pool on the top floor very clean, all towels provided, a life guard on duty at all times temperature of the pool excellent. A very good fitness centre. Breakfast only served in the restaurant a good selection at reasonable prices. The concierge staff were most helpful as was the reception staff and the bell men. Goldie in the gift shop was a lovely character.Fairly close to all main attractions and shops lots of eating places in the area. Can definitely recommend this hotel and would most definitely stay there again if visiting New York.

Reviews.Title: “If I can't be home, this is where I want to be”
Reviews.Author: dimac52
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff continue to provide excellent service everytime I come here on business. Every evening Natalya and Joseph have a big smile on welcoming people coming back from work or a day on the town. Being able to walk to times square, central park or visit the Top of the Rock is great - I went to the Rock with my husband on my last visit and watched the sun set. Restaurants near the hotel are great too. I like going back to the skyline at the end of a long day where I can relax and get a good nights sleep. dm

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: joemascaro
Reviews.Content: Met a group of friends For Labor Day weekend. Stayed at the Skyline... Great location close to the theatres and in the heart of many fantastic restaurants. The service was excellent. Rooms clean and comfortable Slept great. Concierge service was excellent. All of our needs were met with a smile, great advice on all of our activities. Will certainly return hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel,perfect location”
Reviews.Author: narciss
Reviews.Content: Me & my friend went to NYC for a long weekend and we booked this hotel as part of a package deal.I was a little nervous before about the hotel but the reviews on this site helped a little. We got a very warm welcome when we arriaved and we could get in to our room as soon as we got there even though it was before check in time.the room was very clean and spacious and so was the whole hotel.the staff were all very helpful and friendly.1 evening we had dinner cruise booked and when we turned up the boat has already left .we were told to phone and speak to god knows how many people.when we got to the hotel and explained what has happend to the lovely girl at the reception she phoned and sorted it all out.also the location is fantastic.not only it's a 10min walk from time sq it's also in the trendy area of town called Hells kitchen where there's lots of resturants and bars.if we go back to NYC I will defenitly go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: suzie097
Reviews.Content: Upon a recommendation from a NY friend, my husband and I stayed at the Skyline with 3 other couples. The hotel was everything we were looking for...extremely clean, good size rooms, comfortable beds, perfect location, and most important, top notch staff. The sales manager, Matt, makes sure the check-in and check-out process goes smoothly and has staff available to answer all questions about the hotel and your stay in NYC. I've stayed at numerous hotels and the concierge, Kristin, was by far the most helpful I've every experienced. Not only did she have great recommendations of sites to see, she also works with you to find the best price and the most convenient way to get there. You can not beat the price at this hotel which also offers discount overnight parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with beautifully renovated and spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Ohiotraveller1050
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days. The lobby was modern and nice. The rooms including bathrooms have been renovated with a modern polish. The bathroom is spacious. There was also a small refrigerator. It is not a huge hotel, so it is not too busy. This seems to make it more relaxing and a place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The pool is beautiful with a wonderful view of the city. another plus, is that It is close to the theatre district. It is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but needs an update”
Reviews.Author: georgio816
Reviews.Content: Staye here for 5 nights and enjoyed the whole stay. Asked for a quiet room at the rear as had my elderly mother with me. We were granted that and heard no traffic at all. The room was a very small twin and only had a small gap between the bed to go to the bathroom which I must say was tastily decorated and clean. The room was clean but beware we were on the 4th floor and the maid came knocking on the door at 7.45 every morning. The resaurant definately needs a refurbishment , very dull and drab. We used it every day as my mom likes to have breakfast in the hotel and then go back to room to freshen up. There were 2 different prices for Continental and hot breakfast but to be quite honest I don`t know why they don`t just have one price so a selection can be made from both the hot and cold. Would make life easier for them. Would definately go back and sure I will as my son lives over there.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and great location”
Reviews.Author: TedsMum40
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our sons aged 8 & 13 at the end of July, and we were very happy with what we found. The hotel was clean and the staff were always helpful. The location was perfect for a few days sightseeing, an easy walk to Times Square, Broadway etc. We also amde use of the parking next to the hotel, which at just $10 a day was a real bargain. We never made it to the pool as there was just too much else to do! The City Lights Diner just up 10th Avebue was great for a filling breakfast, although we never made it back to try their dinners too!! We would definately stay here again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone looking for a good value hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Close for boardway.”
Reviews.Author: Holiday-Lady25
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for people who want to be close for boardway and time square. We enjoyed our stay and the staff were friendly and helpful. A tip that the hoetel gave us when going to JFK airport it was cheaper to go by cab at a flat $45 than going by the shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “every hotel needs a Victor M. Santos”
Reviews.Author: del_fam85
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from our holiday in NYC. We struggled to find value for a family of 5 near Times Sq. and after many frustrating calls to numerous hotels I rang the Skyline and was put through to reservations, Victor M. Santos was on duty and Skyline, be proud of him. He made booking a room so easy and assigned us a good room. He took the worry from us and I knew that we were in for a good holiday. When we arrived everything was perfect from the reception,to the room,to the pool, everything was great. A great location for a family holiday, give Victor a call......

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: family402
Reviews.Content: Do not expect anything fancy at the Skyline hotel. It is an unassuming, older, yet clean and comfortable 3 star hotel with helpful staff. The price is right (approx 250 USD in high season for a room with 2 double beds. Parking is a mere 10 dollars/day - a steal in NYC- no in and out privilege). The location is perfect for visiting NYC. It is situated in a more "residential" area (Hell's Kitchen) of the city and is within walking distance of 3 subway lines, Central Park (Carousel, zoo, multiple playgrounds - including water play/sprinklers), Time Square and the Theatre District, the Museum of Natural History, great shopping on 5th Avenue, American Girl Place, numerous affordable restaurants, and grocery stores (should you wish to buy breakfast and lunch). There is also a pool. Again, nothing fancy but it does the job for kids before or after a day of sightseeing and activities. Of important note: the pool is only opened in the morning or in the evening after 5 pm. Another important fact: I would not recommend the adjacent restaurant, even for breakfast. The buffet style breakfast food was bland and cold. We are a family of 4 with 2 young children. Our week-long stay was pleasant, and we did not have to break the piggy bank for our NYC adventure. It is no surprise that many families and Europeans seem to have also discovered the Skyline. I would definitely recommend this hotel to families on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “The best stay I've ever had.”
Reviews.Author: purplegurl
Reviews.Content: Well I was coming to New York to visit with friends and I a friend of mine told me about the Skyline hotel. I only stayed for the weekend but my stay was wonderful, thanks to a young woman by the name of Tara. She made me feel right at home, ( to say it short and sweet) She was very very professional in every way and at the same time she was very humble, she made sure that I didn't need anything and if I did she made it happen, nothing to talk about...That was my first time staying in the city but not my last and thanks to Miss Tara everytime I visit New York I will be staying at one of the best hotels I have ever had the plessure of staying in The Skyline Hotel.... I would also like to say thank you to the GM Mark he was very professional on the phone when we spoke about his employee Tara. Keep up the good work.. Thanks again to Tara and GM Mark Sincerely Ms. Davine

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: flowers0529
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New York City and had no idea how the hotel was going to be., but i have to say that the Skyline Hotel was excellent! The rooms were reasonably priced, and it was close to alot of attractions within walking distance. The front desk was very courteous, pleasant, and helpful. There was only ONE lady at the concierge desk that was rude at all times (but we made sure not to ask questions when she was there, we waited for the nicer lady to come in). The twin beds room is a little small , but otherwise, cozy. Other than that, it was a perfect stay, and I would recommend staying there to anyone who has any doubts.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations for the price”
Reviews.Author: cindizzle
Reviews.Content: True, the exterior could use a face lift, but the interior is pleasant. Our room with two queen beds, was very spacious, had a mini frig too. The room was very clean and beds were comfortable. The bathroom is well appointed and spacious. Only complaint is the towels are scratchy. The pool was an added bonus, although it closes for several hours each day. Be sure to check the schedule in the elevator. The staff was friendly and helpful. Easy walking distance to Times Square and the subway. Nice neighborhood with delis on the corner. Parking in the on site garage is only $10/day for hotel guests. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: EugeneChan
Reviews.Content: Both the outside and inside of the hotel requires a facelift. Some of the furnishings were old and the lifts were slow. The rooms were also somewhat old but they were spacious and the beds were comfortable. The air-conditioning unit was loud but it did its job. There were various soaps and moisturisers on offer but there was no coffee or tea facilities. Neither was there a kettle or refrigerator in the room, which would have been useful. However, a fairly large safe was provided. Internet was also not complimentary and this was inconvenient. Check-in was efficient and the lobby was of an ample size. The location is conveniently located approximately 10 minutes walk from Times Square. It is also of a walkable distance to other main attractions such as 5th Avenue, the Rockefeller Centre and the Empire State Building. Breakfast was average. The restaurant service was good but the variety of food was quite poor - only cereal, eggs, bacon, sausages, pancakes and muffins - but after considering the price of the buffet ($15.95), it was good value for money. Overall, it is a quite a nice hotel, albeit old. It is good value for money but it is fairly basic. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good price good location”
Reviews.Author: surreymaria
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well placed for its price, it is not in the centre, but you can get everywhere you need to go on foot.Public transport is also great. Myself and my daugher went Christmas shopping, hotels are always more expensive in December which is why we went to this one. I booked with Expidia and got a really good room for half the price of the other hotels in new york.Reception staff were good, very helpful, the resturant was very cold dont recomend it, but other than that am really glad I chose the skyline. rooms cleaned very well daily.If you go to one of the shopping outlets take a small suitcase with you, I read this tip and thought I would not need to as i am not a big shopper I wish I has listened, you won't look silly lots of peoplw do it. have a great time in NY i did.

Reviews.Title: “Inaccurate Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Ginathemaria
Reviews.Content: While this hotel was excellent in value, the hotel's website has inaccurate accomodation descriptions. I booked a Junior Suite and when I called to confirm the reservation they told me that I was booked for a room with one king sized bed. According to the web site, the room with a king sized bed has a sleeper sofa. The reservations associate told me that the information on the website was inaccurate. My advice to anyone considering this hotel is to make the reservation over the phone and do not rely on the information provided online. It is very misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Skyline Hotel had the cleanest room we've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: krxggx
Reviews.Content: Outside appearance of the Skyline Hotel is not inviting, but walk in the doors and the atmosphere and decor are wonderful. Staff was friendly and helpful, hotel room was spacious and immaculate, with comfortable bed and sheets. The bathroom was on the small side, but it could not have been any cleaner. Cost was very reasonable for NYC and it even has its own garage with a minimal charge of $10/night. You are close to Times Square and all the tourist areas, and we found a lovely outdoor area between 8th & 9th Avenue on 49th Street where Happy Hour is offered with great prices, and food from different restaurants. Lovely area with trees, plants and wonderful atmosphere. I highly recommend The Skyline Hotel and plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good location”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Paisley
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value. Beds were comfy and room was modern and clean. Nothing fancy but met all our needs. No problems at all with the stay (6 nights). Pool is a bit warm but pleasantly located in penthouse. Location convenient to Times Square, Circle Line, Intrepid. There is great deli & grocery across the street, "West Side Famous". Bought breakfast there every day and brought it back to the room. We all loved those NY bagels!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for NYC.”
Reviews.Author: keldon6
Reviews.Content: After much research prior to our trip, we decided on the Skyline for our time in Mid-town Manhattan. Rooms looked to be good size and the rates were were priced lower than others we researched. My husband had business on Long Island during our stay, so we wanted access to MTA, plus be able to be out an about with the family. The hotel has been upgraded (some older reviews are prior to these renovations) and is quite nice. Our room (on the 7th floor) was comfortable and seemed clean. Some nice upgrades, but not all details in order (coverplates not in place, odd table-like piece of furniture on its side taking up room in closet, missing knob on entertainment center). Our toilet clogged (as read in other reviews), took two employees over a course of 8 hours to get it flushing. Housekeeping staff friendly. Our Bellman/Porter, Nick was GREAT! Extremely nice and helpful! Pleasant every time we saw him throughout our stay! We were pleased he was working when we checked out, so we had a chance to say goodbye. He represents his company very well! We looked at the pool, but our schedule didn't permit us time to use it. We did not eat in the restaurant. With children ranging in age from 4 to 13, we were pleased to be within walking distance of most everything we wanted to see - Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, great restaurants etc. Parking at $10 a day is terrific for the city. Be aware that once you park...you can't get to your car until you check out. Would be nice if room had coffee pot and Free WiFi access (although lack of both is noted on website). All in all, we were pleased. The price was great for Manhattan, rooms adequate size for NYC. We would most likely reserve again at the Skyline when visiting NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jhlandford
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel having previously spent 5 nights at the Salisbury hotel. Overall the Salisbury was better but this hotel was fine. The location is good for the theatre district and has plenty of delis and take aways nearby. The entrance lobby is spacious and much more imposing than at the Salisbury. The room size was alright but not as good as the Salisbury. Continental breakfast was nearly twice the price and it's much cheaper to get a takeaway from the 24 hour deli opposite. Staff were very helpful but there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. There is parking at this hotel (which we didn't use) which is quite a bonus for the location

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE AND GREAT LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: lilchrissy2
Reviews.Content: We travelled with 6 women. The rooms are very large especially for New York city. The location is great. In between Times square and Central park. We walked to both. The deli across the street has the best coffee. Rooms need to have coffee makers, and hopefully the bar will be open next time we go back. We will definately book this hotel again. Very pleased!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but did the job”
Reviews.Author: 2taffy
Reviews.Content: Arrived mid day and check in was very quick. We were disappointed with the room as it was very old fashioned and not like the pictures we had seen when booking! It was a large room with 4 beds which wasn't too overcrowded, the decor was not great and looked like a bedroom from the 1970's. It was spotlessly clean, with large flat screen tv and the bathroom had been renovated so it wasn't a problem for us as we were only using it to sleep in. The distance from attractions was okay - after all New York is so big you can't be close to everything!! We were expecting to do a lot of walking and we did!! We did not eat at the hotel as we wanted to be out and about very early, breakfast was mainly a bagel, fruit or bacon roll from the deli opposite which was very reasonable. We did not use the swimming pool as we were too busy so I cannot comment on this. The concierge (Anne) was very helpful and advised us on medical help when one of us was unwell. Overall we had a great time in a fantastic city and just used the hotel as somewhere to sleep. TIP: We bought the New York City Pass before we went and saved an absolute fortune on entry to the major attractions. Cost was $460 for 3 adults and a child. For this we visitied the following: Empire State Building, New York Skyride (within Empire State Building), Maddison Square Gardens (Tour), Madame Taussauds, Cental Park Zoo, Statue of Liberty (Ellis Island Optional), Rockafella Tower, Sea Air Space Museum, The Beast (speedboat ride), Bodies Exhibition. I would thoroughly recommend the pass - we purchased ours online and picked it up in Planet Hollywood shop in Times Square p.s. you also get $10 discount off a meal in Planet Hollywood per adult and children eat free. Hope this review helps and feel free to ask any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Excellent Services”
Reviews.Author: DS90
Reviews.Content: From outside it looks like a Motel but its a nice Small Hotel. Parking is very cheap. Little noisy but Lobby, room, Pool and Gym are well equipped and clean. Hotel should have a Bar. Overall Excellent Services. Friendly Staff specially Tarah was very helpful. At check in I was given all the information and recieved a welcome letter in the room. She went above and beyond and helped me using the Lobby computer. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rbagnall
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the Skyline. Hotel was clean and spacious, in a great location. Staff was friendly and helpful. The pool was a very nice for children. Would definately stay again. Parking was $10 a day, which is a real deal in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Used to stay at Edison!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ocracoke27960
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Edison and know what to expect. We will stay at the Skyline again. Good value, clean and we found all the stall friendly and helpful. Close to subway and times square. Very good parking rate. Big room for the city and it had a fridge. Also found it to be quiet for NY. I think we have a new hotel for NYC

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location but lacking atmosphere and coffee/cocktail lounge.”
Reviews.Author: JBB36
Reviews.Content: Very uninterested staff, not rude but not friendly either. Rooms comfortable and clean but only an ice bucket and plastic cups - go to 2nd floor for ice machine and that's it. Consequently, nowhere to sit for a coffee/tea or drink of any sort other than taking things to bedroom from deli opposite. As 4 of us in party (2 couples in our 50's) it would have been nice to relax and drink (not necessarily alcohol) either in the morning or evenings when returning from long days sightseeing. No nice bars nearby for the purpose. However, this was the only 'complaint'. The hotel is convenient walking distance for getting to Times Square area, tour buses, subway, Broadway shows etc, so no need for extra expense on taxis. Also walked to piers for naval museum and boat trip. Rooms clean (one iron didn't work and some plug sockets were temperamental). Towels changed daily and bed linen every 2 days (stayed one week). Overall good value for money and clean - just lacking atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Security Officer great with plunger, so-so with AC”
Reviews.Author: rockchalkalabama
Reviews.Content: I would reccomend this hotel for anyone staying in Manhattan. Great location for sightseeing. I have a family of four with two teenagers. The 2 bed queen room was large enough for all of us. The toilet backed up once, but within 2 minutes of calling the front desk, a very helpful security officer had arrived with our room with plunger in tow. The ac did not work super great. It spit out cool air but took a long time to cool the room. Security officer also tried to fix this but it didn't work. I did not try to change rooms, it wasn't that bad. We primarily picked this hotel for the pool, a rarity in Manhattan, which had an incredible view as the sun was setting of the skyline. If this is important to you, I woul call in advance to check that it will indeed be open and what hours.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location in the heart of the city, times square is just a foot step away, 5 minutes to walk.”
Reviews.Author: tripaholicBudapest
Reviews.Content: The location is the best about the hotel, it is very close to times square . The hotel stuff is not extremly friendly, but also not rude. They do what is their job, but they do not give any extra to that. (smile, nice words). One good thing is that as we arrived they saw that we are 4 and they said they put us in a bigger room. One other good thing was that they have a travel agent next to the reception and you can reserve trips, ask questions about the city attractions, and purchase tickets. It is worth to buy the ticket for the Empire state building, it cost the same, but you do not have to stand in line at the building to buy your entry ticket. Andt there are a lot of people at the building! All in all we had a good stay at the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest time in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: sunlover44
Reviews.Content: This hotel does looks a bit run down as the first impression goes, but boy, I was wrong. The rooms are spacious, super clean, comfortable bedding, bathroom was neat and did I say the room was clean? Very clean. Conveniently located on 10th and 49th street, just 4 blocks from Time Square. Also, very affordable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Facilites advertised are not available when you arrive”
Reviews.Author: LeicesterLil
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from this hotel where I stayed with 5 friends. One of the main reasons for staying there was it had a cocktail bar open until 2.00am. No it doesn't it has been shut and they don't know when it will open as someone needs to take over the lease. Also advertised is lunch and dinner. You can't get any food except breakfast. You can't even get a cup of coffee, you have to go over the road to the deli, which is very good as are the panni's!!.. The rooms are small if there is 4 of you and the loo blocks alot. On a better note, the pool is fab as is the gym. Very good location for Times Square only 2 blocks. Just be warned, facilites are not as advertised!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: J30Kent
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from all members of staff from bell boy, housekeeping and concierge. Room very spacious and clean. The concierge Ann was extremely helpful and recommended some wonderful places to see and eat.

Reviews.Title: “too much $ poor service”
Reviews.Author: mickeyQuincy
Reviews.Content: went there for weekend. ignorant staff, eyes rolling conc. service, broken ac. windows with no screens. pushy staff at attraction counter."discounted tickets were $170 at hotel. got better seats for $125 at box office. maid service that don't speak english! the hidden fee for storage after checkout.. free for checkin. after checking out, take your bags and go. no room for storage without a charge. the only thing good about it was it "looked nice" makes it look fancier than it is!

Reviews.Title: “Can't get better in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Ebbalow
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Skyline twice and both times I have found the staff to be very pleasent(except for the scary women in the gift shop). The rooms are spacious, two double beds and very clean bathroom- what more do you need... Location is very good too. Far enogh out that you can sleep but close enough to enjoy the sites. Time square is very close not many restaurants on the same street as hotel but a decent selection of diffrent types of restaurants on 50th st, one street up.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: rachdinsd
Reviews.Content: Me and my mother just returned from 5 days in New York, i have never been before so didnt know quite what to expect,. I have high expectations and my pet hate is bad customer service therefore when we booked this hotel i was a little worried however as we knew we would only be sleeping in the hotel we didnt want to pay for a 5* hotel (i know that you get what you pay for and that was my concern). Upon arrival to the Skyline Hotel directly infront of the door is the reception desk where we were aknowledged straight away and dealt with in a quick yet proffesional manner, we were advised were our room was but not offered a wake up call or newspapers (however as the days when on we realised that this might not be an option in this hotel), we were on the third floor overlooking a building roof with no real 'skyline' view to speak of and dont know from having looked at the building how many guests would have a room with a 'skyline' view as the hotel was lower than most surrounding buildings, never the less there was the twin beds that we had booked a clean bathroom and a TV. There was no welcome pack in the room however was a conceirge desk by reception so if you had any questions they were always on hand to help along with the bell man. We found them helpful at all times, never rude but never over friendly (for the star of hotel i feel you could not ask for much more). We left the hotel early everyday and returned late every evening as the purpose for our trip was to look around the whole of Manhatten (we did ALL of this on foot, having done that i would defo recommend getting the subway to destinations that are in the financial district if you want to see Ground Zero, we walked there and back and it took 3 hours each way!) Each evening when we got back to the room the beds were remade and clean which was nice. To sum up my review i would recommend this hotel to all types of guests if you were going to be sleeping at the hotel but were not looking for top end luxury. Staff were on hand if you needed them and were never rude would defo stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: dollywood0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from April 12th for a week and were delayed for a further 8 days due to the volcanic ash cloud. The hotel staff juggled the bookings around to enable us to stay in our original room and were really friendly and helpful. We heard that other hotels had increased their prices, but this hotel gave us a discount for the extra week. The hotel has basic amenities but is comfortable and clean. The rooms were spacious and the bed linen and towels were changed every day. The breakfast place attached to the hotel was disappointing, but there's a great diner just up the road serving excellent food at low cost. The view across the Manhatten Skyline from the swimming pool (8th floor) is wonderful - especially at night. The location is ideal for walking to Times Square, Empire State Building and Central Park. The subway - Uptown, downtown and crosstown - is a couple of blocks away. There are loads of restaurants within a couple of minutes walk. 2 deli's across the road doing amazing sandwiches and salads. The Amish market on 9th Avenue has a great self selection of foods and drinks. Try the Hibernia Bar on 50th street and Gossips on 9th Avenue for a lively night out. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If all you need is a bed for the night, this is OK”
Reviews.Author: aod326
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were volunteering at the NYC half-marathon and needed to be in the city early on Sunday morning, so we were just looking for somewhere decent to sleep. This hotel accepts pets, but the rooms have thin walls - not a good combination. The people in one of the rooms on our floor were out until 3am-ish and their dog yapped the entire time they were out. The room didn't feel very clean at all and the bedding was very tired. Check out the next day was s-l-o-w. However, overnight car-parking is only $10. We will not go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: ruaugusta
Reviews.Content: We (my son and I) spent 6 days at this hotel. He came from Brazil to visit me and it was the 1st time we stayed at this hotel. What a pleasant surprise! Our room with 2 double beds was big, enough space to move around. Very unusual for NY city. Very clean, quiet and close to everything. Accross the street from the hotel are 2 delis open 24/7 with fresh bagels, nice sandwichs and fresh salads and dinners to go. I really recommed this hotel. Great location, great rooms, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful Stay! Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Holmes89
Reviews.Content: Went to NYC with 7 other girls to celebrate our birthdays. Arrived on the 13th April and was staying for 5 days. Loved the hotel, our rooms were massive, enough room for 3 18-20 year old girls to spread all our clothes and shopping everywhere! The rooms were really clean and nicely decorated. The hotel is in a brilliant location close to Times Square, Rockerfeller Centre and Broadway! and near to enough Subway stations to tour the rest of the city. The staff were more than helpful always giving us tips and advice. We were over there when the Iceland Volcano errupted so we ended up stranded for 8 days longer than planned and the hotel staff were amazing we couldn't have asked for more. Would reccomend this hotel to anybody and will be visiting New York again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Ane_feierabend
Reviews.Content: I found the Hotel very good, the room was big and clean. The TV was big. The staff was friendly. ItÂ´s near most attractions, but is an empty area at night. I donÂ´t know if IÂ´d stay there again, probably would look for a hotel in another location.

Reviews.Title: “not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Shirinak
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after staying in fairfield hotel in 8th ave for 3 days because it was cheaper, I called them to ask if I can store my luggage for one day before checking it and they say yes and free of charge. when I took them they take 10 dollors fo 6 bags for one day. check in was easy but most receptianests are old and do not care about the gust. there was no internet in the room and just 2 in the lobby that one of them was brocken down during my stay and nobody care!!! room was dirty, blancket was burned!!! and the border of the bed sheat was very dirty. you can say everybody in this samll hotel (just 5 floor) was unprofessional. my room was in 4th floor and it was very noisy from the street and car parking next to the bulding.service is very poor. beackfast was not included and lobby restroom needed card to enter. when you calculate the breakfast, internet, cleanness and noise, you can find better hotel whith same price. I don't recomend this to anybody

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DibMaidstone
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for 4 nights. Cant beat location, really easy to get to the subway, its walking distance to Times Square, Top of the Rock, and loads of restaurants on ninth Ave. Recommend City Lights Diner . Just turn left outside the hotel, and is 2 minutes walk on the other side of the road. Lovely breakfast, and just how you imagine an american diner to be. Hotel was clean- suppose the staff could be friendlier, but dont really care about that! Would stay there again because of the location. We had a great view out of our window. Used to lay in bed looking at the Empire State Building! If you want to get the train from the airport its really easy. From JFK get the air train to Jamica station then subway E getting off at 50 th street then you can walk from there. What a wonderful trip. LOVED New York. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place , not great staff”
Reviews.Author: Momma-Plante
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because my kids wanted an indoor pool. Not many hotels offer that amenity in NYC so my options were limited. I was thrilled to book a 2 room Junior suite and let my kids swim in the Pent House pool. I was nothing but impressed with my room and the entire aesthetics of this hotel. Oh, parking is only $10 - wow that was a great deal! My main issue with the Skyline is the staff! Considering I thought I was staying at a higher end hotel I was completely shocked at the lack of friendliness. Maybe there is a language barrier or maybe some employees are just miserable. The concierge was NOT helpful to me or other patrons. I over heard a few conversations with others while in the lobby. Other things that turned me away from the Skyline was the fact that you have to pay for a cup of coffee. With no coffee maker in any rooms, you MUST purchase it from the breakfast restaurant off of the lobby. NO free internet. Even Mc Donalds has free wifi connection. After we checked out my family wanted to see one more attraction. I asked to hold my bags until we were ready to leave NYC ( which was about 1.5 hours) and I had to PAY for each bag to be held. With a family of 5, 3 of them girls, you can imagine we had more than 1 bag. After the $500 I spent on a room for that one night, I was insulted. Overall, there were many positives about my stay here. The main thing that would keep me from ever returning is the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: karenpStLouis
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the Skyline. I do have to say however, the front desk clerks at both check in and check out were not exactly the friendliest....the bellman, however, was very nice. The room itself, was very clean and nice sized with a nice sized bathroom. The room had 2 full beds, a small refrigerator and a new flat screen TV. The walls did seem thin, however. I could hear the child next to us most of the night, and also the person above us walking back and forth all night! This would not stop me from staying here again, though! The price was good for NYC. I booked on their website, and you got a discount for the more nights you booked. The price of parking ($10 a day) was more than reasonable for the city!! The hotel was in easy walking distance of Times Square, and the theatres and restaurants. I would say here again!

Reviews.Title: “adequate hotel but seen better days”
Reviews.Author: TravellingGal83
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this hotel before so decided that due to the good location, I would stay again. However, it seemed that nothing had changed (apart from the new TVs) since I had last stayed there 5 years ago. The outside of the hotel does not have the 'wow' factor but the foyer is nice and the staff helpful. The rooms however, have seen better days. The bathroom suite needs a complete overhaul / deep clean and the bedding was yellowing/old, however, it was clean. The location of the hotel is good, 49th and 10th. A 5-10 minute walk from Times Square and Broadway. Overall, if you only want somewhere to rest your head at the end of a long day of sightseeing then this hotel is adequate for your needs (which it was for us). However, if you want to sleep and bathe in luxury, then I suggest you stay in the Hilton up the road!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mommy11837
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers I had read many reviews that talked about rude staff and parking attendants but I did not experience any of this. The people we dealt with at the front desk were very nice and the tall curly haired bell man was eager to help. The bell man that was in on our last day was not as friendly but he was in no way rude. Rooms were clean and spacious, although there was a problem with the outlet in between the beds and the lights and clock weren't working. Not a big deal for us. I've definitely stayed in nicer hotels but only paid $143 per night and was within walking distance of almost everything we wanted to do so it worked out great! My kids LOVED the heated pool on the penthouse floor. You also can't beat the price of parking. Just $10 a day!

Reviews.Title: “A Terrible Stay 4/2/10”
Reviews.Author: loriannejames
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here; it is not worth the savings. Terrible hotel, terrible service. We encountered an issue and tried to get it resolved with the onsite staff; however, they all from security to the front desk clerk proved to be useless. It's embarrassing for them and will sure prove to be damaging for them at some point down the road. A complete dump and should be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “If you must drive, this is the place to be!”
Reviews.Author: MyBackPages
Reviews.Content: I drove, and paid the same amount for 4 days that I pay for one day of parking at work in Boston! Clean rooms, nice staff, good service, (I can't believe we never checked out the rooftop pool!), comfortable beds, all-in-all a nice place for a good price! Great location, lots of bars & restaurants and one block from 9th Ave which is the current hot spot... Felt safe the whole time, met all kinds of locals and people on the street that were friendly and fun and helpful (I LOVE NYC). If I could change anything it would be the paper-thin walls which would have been fine if we weren't on a up-late-sleep-late kind of trip :-) Having the car led me here instead of other places I already knew I loved, but I was not disappointed and will return again in the same circumstances! Go to Druids, an Irish place across the street, for the hidden courtyard in the back. A great place to start and end the night!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: altrnatif
Reviews.Content: I did not experience the bad customer service as reported by others, in fact quite the opposite. The hotel is quite nice, and in comparison to the Amsterdam Court nightmare I had, this place is like heaven! It is a budget place but clean, comfortable, convenient to the city, no complaints whatsoever. Oh, even has a room safe for your goodies.

Reviews.Title: “worse customer servce ever”
Reviews.Author: shoshty
Reviews.Content: the receptianest and the security guerd were very rude and unprofessional they threaten and humilited me and my family, treated us in a very bad way and unfortunately the manager didn't do anything to them. Plus it is not clean and the service is very poor. I don't recomended to any budy

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, with bad service.”
Reviews.Author: dbchile
Reviews.Content: The skyline is a nice hotel, located near time square. The room was comfortable, and the price was reasonble. The staff is not very helpful, but at least they have a concierge service. We had breakfast at the hotel, and it was a bit overpriced for what they offered. The wi-fi has a charge of 10 dolars a day aprox. If you donÂ´t need speccial attention from the staff, and want a good location in manhattan with a reasonable price, this could be a good option for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: DCDave_10
Reviews.Content: -Easy to find, especially if you are coming to NY from the Lincoln Tunnel -Parking was cheap and the parking guys were polite and very good -Front desk people, bell caps and concierge were all great -Good size rooms with very comfortable beds -It was great to take my kids on a walk to the pier and the Intrepid Museum -We walked to Time Square, got great a discount on theatre tickets, had a great NY deli lunch and went to our show -We all loved the heated 20ftx40ft (I think) pool -Great views too Great property, great service, great location and great amenities - I'll stay there again - thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KBNJ_10
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Skyline Hotel was great. Our family of five was very comforable in the Jr. suite. Two TV's was an added plus, and the indoor pool was great. It served our family needs well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.....great location.....New York New York”
Reviews.Author: SATC33
Reviews.Content: Had read many reviews on this website before travelling and can honestly question some people's expectations?? This is a lovely hotel, with very pleasant staff. 10 min walk from Times Square, with numerous bars, 24/7 shops across the road...very centrally placed for a great holiday. Only in NY for a long weekend and honestly used Skyline as a base to lay my head for a few hours inbetween sight seeing and shopping and.....after all, it is the city that never sleeps!!!! (nothing to do with the hotel and more to do with NY traffic although views are stunning and more than make up for it). Would recomend this hotel to all travelling groups including families who would brave NY with children. Area is very safe and shouldnt put people off.

Reviews.Title: “Great "base camp" for New York exploration”
Reviews.Author: Belford_NJFlybynite
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby, public areas, breakfast and bar. Short pool schedule, but worth arranging the day to accomodate a relaxing soak in the 92 degree pool. It was wonderful. Our room on the west side was dead quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: chrisontour
Reviews.Content: I had read many reviews and seen loads of pictures of the hotel before we went to spend 5 nights over New Year, but it surpassed my expectations. Thanks to the added security. we arrived several hours late so it was dark when we arrived. When we arrived in our room the curtains were closed, I pulled back the curtains to be greeted with the wonderful view of the Empire State Building dressed in her Christmas colours. Wonderful! The rooms were good, bathrooms were good, although a little dated, staff helpful. Only small complaint was that the maid had a habit of knocking and walking in before you could stop her. There was a little Deli opposite to the left from outside reception entrance called Ramses which did lovely hot chocolate, tea, coffee, beers and sandwiches made to order. The bagels fresh in the morning were wonderful, cream cheese and crispy bacon mmmmmm, I can taste them now. If you go 1 block up 49th to 9th Ave and turn left, you will find Gossip, This is lovely bar and restaurant. Most of the staff are Irish and really friendly. The steaks are great and very reasonably priced, around $19. For a blow the budget, try Uncle Jacks on 9th Street. The Porter House is the biggest and best steak I've ever tried, and as for the baked potato, well it was huge! New York was everything I expected and more. I can't tell you enough I love it!

Reviews.Title: “NYC”
Reviews.Author: Brownsville
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to the fact that we were going to have to park our van overnight for four nights. The overnight parking was only $10/day!! Incredible price in NYC. Also, the hotel is only 2 blocks from Broadway and all the major attractions in Time Square. The hotel is located in what is commonly known as "Hell's Kitchen". We also chose the hotel due to the rooftop indoor pool, since we were traveling with our boys. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel near centre”
Reviews.Author: 2Nice
Reviews.Content: i stayed for a couple of night in the skyline hotel as it was recommended as relatvely cheap and good and it was. I didnt use the pool (didnt even know they had one) or gym. location is great. no problem getting a taxi. 10 minute walk to broadway and i dint feel unsae at all. Breakfast is somewhat confusing. there is a buffet but you can also order at your table. I didnt bother to find out why but I had to pay some additional breakfast items but i could have them put on my bill. Just a good cheap hotel near he centre. Slept like a baby. only minor point: when i received my creditcard bill and I was charged for my colleagues room as well, the hotel didnt respond to my email concerning this issue

Reviews.Title: “great price, great location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ed74cj5
Reviews.Content: For anyone on a budget, this is a great place to stay. The great thing is that it does not lack in quality. The lobby is beautiful, the rooms are big and clean, and everyone is very helpful. This is a hidden gem as far as Manhattan hotels go. 15 min. walk to Times Square, 10 min. walk to Broadway theatres. The #1 subway train is located at 50th and 8th which is maybe an 8 minute walk. Also for a cheap eat and cold beer check out 1-2-3 Burger Shot Beer! It's about a half block north on the east side of 10th ave. $1 burgers(sliders), $2 shots, and $3 beers. So if you want the Waldorf Astoria, go stay at the Waldorf Astoria. But if you want a great value hotel that does not lack in quality, stay at the Skyline!

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: world_weary069
Reviews.Content: not a five star hotel, but at the bargain rates, a real treat--clean, neat, fantastic location. parking next door for $10/night, cannot be beat. we spent maybe 2 waking hours a day in the room, so we didn't mind that the amenities were not copious. it was perfect for what we needed--the shower was excellent, and the beds were comfortable. easy walking distance to midtown, times square, 5th ave, 30 rock, theatre district. don't miss the galaxy diner on 9th/47th for breakfast. . .miles better than the city lights diner others have recommended. tonnes of good hell's kitchen restos on 9th. concierge can be wonderful--if gabriel is at the desk, he will not steer you wrong! h&h bagels is about 8 mins away, and 50th st c/e station is just two streets over. nice lcd, small fridge, but no coffeemaker or kettle. will definitely stay here again, the next time i'm in nyc

Reviews.Title: “At a rock bottom price, could you ask for more?”
Reviews.Author: Abj13
Reviews.Content: My wife and her parents stayed 12/16/09-12/18/09 and at only $125 per night, I couldn't ask for a better price or place. I was impressed by many things. Staff was helpful in explaining things. Rooms were tastefully decorated and clean. Each had a small fridge for dinner leftovers. Valet service in attached garage is only $10 per day, but you must leave your car there. Complaints? Things almost too silly to mention. Bathroom had a stand up shower and I didn't like that the shower curtain hung down into the shower floor. No fan in bathroom to help with steam or stench (lol). The rooms were very toasty, and I ran the A/C unit just to bring it down to a comfortable level (to my wife's standard that is). I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OK Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Im-away-again
Reviews.Content: Located on 10th Ave this hotel is about 15 mins walk from Times square which is no real problem. The rooms are big for NYC and are clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was disappointing (go to BizCo Latte just down the road) as the food was cold - several people complained that morning and nothing was done, dining room was cold also. Considering the cost this is good value for money. One downside is the thin walls and floors - we had the people above us playing what seemed to be football at 1 am in the morning. Would I stay here again - possibly, but I would look around first and maybe accept a smaller room and pay a bit more. It did not spoil our holiday and served as a reasonable base to see the sights. There are lots of good places to eat just one block away on 9th Ave and a great all night Pizza takaway across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location...thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: byekids!
Reviews.Content: One block from Hell's Kitchen and about a 15 minute walk to Times Square. Great restaurants of every origin on 9th. Pool was fun for our kids. Good parking deal ($10 if you're not driving an SUV). Only negative was the room itself...decor was fine/seemed updated (except for the bathroom...old/dated), but the walls were SO THIN! I could hear Jay Leno's monologue from the TV in the room next to us even though it didn't seem to be turned up very loud. Only other negative was a brawling couple 2 doors down screaming at the top of their lungs at midnight, but security responded very quickly (don't get the idea that it's a scary place...just a scary couple). Parking staff could have been friendlier, bell/luggage guys very nice/helpful. We stayed in the "shorter" building - actually on 10th. Might not hear as much traffic higher up, but it is NYC. Good value for what you're getting...just don't expect a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ayrshireinmd
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. Having previously stayed in a few other midtown hotels (ranging from boutique to large chain), this was as good as any of them. On the surface the area is a little bit run down, but we never once felt threatened and were able to walk to all major midtown attractions. The rooms were spotlessly clean and larger than average in the city. The public areas were warm and welcoming, and the staff were friendly enough. We never used the pool or gym. We had driven up from MD and parking was quick and easy. It is attendant-parking, and comes in at $10 per night when staying at the hotel. We wanted to keep the car in later on the day of check-out, so the hotel covered it until 3pm and then we paid the garage owners an extra $15 for the final 4 hours. I'd say $25 is reasonable for 18 hours of parking in NYC. There are two delis across the street, with the one at the corner of 48th/10th doing a good breakfast. All-in-all, I would definitely stay here again. I can imagine some of my more 'cautious' friends would dislike the area and opt to stay over on 5th or Park - but I'd rather keep the extra $200 that would be needed to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: sassieNottingham
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 5 night stay at the skyline and was not disappointed. the rooms were spacious and comfortable with good beds. bathroom was very nice. good location with times square and rockefeller less than 10 min walk. this is an ideal place to stay with good value for money. would stay again definitely and recommend to anyone who wants a nice room in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PoppitMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a budget option for NY as we were staying 10 days. Whilst our room was very small it was clean and the bathroom was new. Only comment would be that the water pressure in the shower was non existent, but there was a bath that saved the day. The location was great and there were really good restaurants in the immediate area. A quick walk up 49th Street had you in the buzz of NYC. We felt very safe walking at any time time of the day and night in the local area. Cabs were plentiful and much cheaper than I had thought they would be.

Reviews.Title: “Skyline adds Sparkle to Manhattan...Fabulous Stay!”
Reviews.Author: pocavidz
Reviews.Content: You know that feeling when you are about to leave home to go somewhere exciting and you're hoping that the hotel you have booked turns out to be amazing? My wish came true. Skyline is more like a 4 1/2 to 5 star hotel. The suites are divine..." a home away from home". There is soooo much space in the rooms, and they are super clean. The bed is very comfy. The hotel staff...from the doorman, reception service to the cleaning service is very friendly and professional. Our suite was very impressive and the view was breathtaking... especially in the evening with the manhattan skyline. Location is central. You can walk to the theater district, times square and cabs/subway are very accesible. There is a choice or restaurants or delis nearby. Overall...I had an amazing stay in Manhattan thanks to Skyline Hotel. "It's a home away from home and truelly a hidden Gem". I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Except for One Caution”
Reviews.Author: billjennifershorts
Reviews.Content: The caution: don't pay for parking twice! They fail to tell you that you've already paid for parking when you check out. I didn't notice the item on our bill until days after we returned home. Otherwise, the place is convenient, clean, including the room, common areas, restaurant, pool, etc.. Our room included a large screen TV, nice desk chair and fridge. Staff is friendly although the concierge seemed a bit stand-offish. Overall, well worth the price and we plan to stay there again. Oh - and it doesn't look like much from the outside, but the inside has obviously been redone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very rude valet, unconcerned bellhop”
Reviews.Author: travel2placessince74
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was nice, clean, and large. The room in which we booked was a double, with nice comfortable beds. The restaurant was reasonably priced and came with large portions. The valet staff was very rude from the time of entrance to check out. Also, it is highly advisable that if you wish to obtain something out of your car in the middle of your stay that you actually get it out upon arriving. Although the valet price was $10, I would much rather pay more for better service and less rudeness (we've stayed at alot of big hotels around the US and not experienced this much rudeness ever until now). A major note....if you book the hotel online and need to make a modification you will have to call during the weekday to make any changes..it is better if you call the 800 number provided on the website instead of booking online. Other things aside , the hotel is a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveler104
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to NYC for Thanksgiving and 5 very good nights at the Skyline Hotel. We had lodging plans made earlier fall through which left me looking for 2 rooms for 4 adults and 1 4-yr old at the last minute at a rate that wouldn't bankrupt me. I found the Skyline and after reading the reviews here booked the rooms and crossed my fingers. As soon as we stepped in the lobby, I knew it was going to be OK. Check in was quick and efficient and we received rooms well in advance of the check in time. The Lobby and the trip to the elevator had an art deco feel going back to when hotels really were a treat. A couple of days after our arrival we returned to see Holiday decorations out all though the lobby making it just sparkle. It was very nice. The rooms were large with king bed, a pullout sofa, a desk, an armoire with drawers and which hid a small refrigerator, a vanity counter with hair dyer and still room for my 4 yr old granddaughter to have room to play. The bathroom was nothing speical but completely adequate with nice towels. Both rooms were spotless the day we checked in, the carpet was still a little damp from the steam cleaning and for the most part housekeeping duiring the week was acceptable. Our plastic wrapped glasses were never replenished the whole time in either room and if a cup was left with something in it, it was not disposed of. These were minor, but still enough to make it just less than "very good" We are pretty low maintenance after we check in somewhere so we didn't need the Concierge or any help except for a small maintenance issue on the AC unit in one of the rooms and it was fixed. The staff was friendly and pleasant each time we came into contact with them. The older lady who worked in the gift shop was a jewel. The restaurant did not seem to be one of their stand-outs, we only ate once and that was for breakfast the day we left, we were just going to order off the menu but were encouraged to do the buffet which was out of just about everything and by the time they got it refilled we had to go. Everyone appeared to blame someone else and the fact that they go ahead and stick on the gratuity kind of rubbed me the wrong way. It was mostly empty and with so much good food around I cant see much of a reason to choose it. There was a bar we had drinks a couple of nights, it was pretty dead but we were not looking for big party just someplace quiet to end up the evening and that is what we got. As far as food in the neighborhood, too many good little pizzerias to mention. The City Lights Diner and the Renaissance Diner were stand outs.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: johnny16
Reviews.Content: We reserved a deluxe queen room which was in the newer part of the hotel in back. The room was very large for NYC standards and recently renovated. We had room 646 which faced north. If you want a better view, ask for a south facing room (I think they ended in _34 to _41) or some thing like that. You can't tell the difference between these rooms and a decent Marriott or nice Holiday Inn -- except in the wallet. The $10 parking and indoor pool (an extreme rarity) are icing on the cake. I liked that it was off the beaten path. We got to see how real Manhattanites live and the restaurants aren't tourist traps. There are many, many restaurant choices in the Hell's Kitchen area, most casual and reasonably priced, and most deliver. Empanada Mama's was great. I think we'll be staying here every time we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Skyline Hotelâ€Ž”
Reviews.Author: jimmygu3
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Skyline for Thanksgiving. It had everything we needed for our family of 4 (kids age 8 & 10). They loved the pool, and so did we! Our room had a nice view of the city and the beds were comfortable. They had nice plasma TVs but no HD service as far as I could tell. Staff was always friendly and helpful. Bis. Co. Latte at 47th & 10th was a great place for morning coffee, biscotti and fresh fruit. Just about everything required walking over to 7th, 8th or 9th avenue, but we like walking in the city so it was no big deal. Many subway lines stop around 50th & 8th. Taxi was about $32 each way from LGA. From what I can remember, the WiFi was $10/1 day, $25/3 days, $35/5 days, or $40/month. We booked through getaroom.com and got a great deal. While other hotels were over $250/nt for Thanksgiving week, we got the Skyline for about $160. Great hotel overall!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located, large rooms, comfy beds !!”
Reviews.Author: njb310
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Skyline hotel from the 12th November - 16th November, it was faberooney ! The room was very spacious, with 2 queen size beds in it which were really comfortable ! The staff very friendly. We did not eat in the hotel, across the street the Deli on the corner was excellent for hot drinks and homemade food. There was a little bit of noise from the outside, but you are sooo tired you really don't realise LOL Yellow cab from airport was about $65. Would reccommend ideally located near times square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: verstreken
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a long weekend New York staying at the Skyline hotel. As a Hotel ( Sales Director ) I can highly recommend this hotel for people that want excellent value for their money. The hotel is idealy located in a reasonable quit surrounding for New York, altough very close (walking distance ) to Times square, the Hop -on/of bus, shops, etc,... . The hotel might not look very attractive from the outside, but the insight is nice and has all you need. The room we booked ( Queen Double ) was very spacious with comfortable and large beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: TwinMountain
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Skyline the night before we left NYC for a seven night cruise. The location of the hotel in relation to the pier was perfect. The $10 a night parking seemed too good to be true but it was. Our car was in perfect condition upon check-out. The check-in process was very easy and the young man at the desk, Tyrone, was very professional and friendly. Our room was large, very clean and well appointed. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was huge as it was handicapped accessible. As owners of a small motel ourselves we are very picky when it comes to cleanliness and the Skyline passed with flying colors. Would highly recommend this hotel and for less then $300 it might be considered a bargain for the city.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: chicco
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel on Trip Advisor after reading a lot of reviews of New York Hotels . What a pleasant surprise - the Hotel was within easy walking distance of Time Square and all the shops, but in a quiet location. Very clean with friendly staff. The pool was an added bonus for my 2 younger teenage grand-daughters who we were treating to the short break in New York on a trip from England. The staff were very helpful and pleasant, the Bell Captain was especially helpful, he handled all the Bags for us, and found taxis when we needed them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but not sure it's worth the price”
Reviews.Author: aintnorock
Reviews.Content: I'm becoming convinced that there are no value hotels in all of NYC. I spent $300 for what was advertised thusly: "King executive with seating area." What I got was 2 Queen beds and 2 chairs to sit in. I didn't have time to complain, so I just accepted it - at least it was bigger than the closets I've stayed in elsewhere. It was about 5 blocks from Times Square. We walked to a show, then got a cab back. There were a lot of shops and restaurants just one block away on 9th avenue, not so many on 10th where the hotel is. The neighborhood is Hells Kitchen. The place is old, but the decor is acceptable, the carpets seem almost new, and the place was very clean. The mattress was lumpy, but good enough for me to get a good night's sleep. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but checked out the menu which looked adequate, and the prices were not too bad. Check in went smoothly and the staff was friendly. My key cards failed the first time around and then again later so I had to walk back down to the desk to get my cards re-keyed. One thing this hotel was missing that I think should be available is a door man to help with luggage and cabs, and there was none. I had to bring my luggage all the way indoors before they offered help. And I had to hail my own cabs. Not a real inconvenience, but I emjoy the luxury of having someone else do that for me. I noticed that a concierge was on duty every time I was in the lobby, including midnight. I didn't bring my computer, but noticed they did have wi-fi. It wasn't free however. I just feel that at $300 a night they can afford to give you the internet for free. Will I stay there again? Probably not. I'm still in search of a good hotel with rates that won't break me.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for first time visit to New York”
Reviews.Author: Jimimck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Skyline as part of a Cosmos Bus Tour across the States. We stayed five nights and found the hotel to be just what we wanted. The service was average, but didn't experience any bad service so that was OK. The room was nice and spacious, with room for two people to spread their luggage out. The bathroom was bigger than expected, and was clean and tidy. We were expecting it to be way out of the way, but were pleasantly surprised at its central location. Was only a few blocks away from Times Square and Subway stations to get you to the rest of Manhattan. The pool was great, with some nice views of the skyline from the 10th floor. Didn't use the restaurant as we read some reviews here and decided to experience as much of New York as possible. The diner down the road (Citylights Diner) was absolutely the best place for breakfast. Its just a couple of blocks away and had very cheap, very good food available. I would certainly stay here again when I return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: NightOwl28
Reviews.Content: We received a really good deal on this hotel. For the money it was very clean and we had a great night sleep after hours and hours of waliking in the city. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, good location, Friendly Helpful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: GuestGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a whole week at the Skyline and must say the Beds are some of the most comfortable beds we've ever slept in. And Comfy pillows too ! The Staff were very helpful and pleasant which always makes a big difference.

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the way / second Rate Hotel - but OK”
Reviews.Author: geocachegang
Reviews.Content: Just spend 3 nights with my wife there on a 3 day trip to NYC. I would describe it as a 2 star hotel which has seen better days years ago. Old fashioned decor throughout which dates it back to the 50's. Bar was dark and dismall. Swimming pool was ok - it i a plus for staying here - but it has limited opening hours....and is also a bot old.... It is 15 minute slow walk out of the main drag of Times Square etc - and the area it is located in - is not particularly nice at all - but safe ish now ( A drunk prostitute was seen by me entering the bar !! Would I go there again - No. Would I recommend it - only if you can get a cheap deal and expect not to spend any time in the hotel apart from sleeping

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in good location”
Reviews.Author: pink_sar8
Reviews.Content: It was a nice place in a good location but that was it. Somewhat clean, bathroom wasn't all that great but was ok. With the price i paid i expected a little better but then it was close to attractions. The conceirge was rude and did not help at all. It was noisy as i had a room above the train track which came out just below my window so was woken at all hours of the night with the noise and hotel shaking from the train. Also was woken by drunk guests coming and going from the night club downstairs of all hours. The morning i left i had to be picked up at 3am by the airport shuttle and was treated rudely by the desk clerk when the shuttle hadn't arrived and i asked if i could call them. She rudely handed the phone over and offered no assistance. Then when a passaby threw up on the outside steps she did not hurry herself to get someone to clean up. 30minutes later when another staff came to clean it up he threw a bucket of water at it and then left it. This was a huge hazard right in the middle of the stairs. Apart from these problems the room itself was ok and location was good considering it was New York. I wouldn't stay there again but then i'm not about to return to NYC anytime soon either as it's a dirty and rude city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: IrelandShopaholic
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 5 night stay in the Skyline hotel. The hotel was very clean and the rooms very spacious. We got upgraded as they did not have the original room i booked. The ate in the restaurant and it was fine but for breakfast you can not beat the little deli across the road on the corner of 49th and 10th avenue for a cheap breakfast especially if you have kids.. The rooftop pool was a real bonus in the warm weather and great to let the kids jump into after a busy day. All in all this was a good hotel that i would definitely stay in again and a good price also.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Pleasant Staff, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Michael9969
Reviews.Content: Family of four. All adults. Stayed for 6 nights in two Queen suites. . Should have made it longer. The rooms were large and comfortable. The Staff were always helpful. The concierge booked tickets to a play for two of us. We had two cars with our two suites. Cars stayed parked for the entire stay for $10.00 each per day. We were a little concerned about the parking - it is not operated by the Hotel. However, there were no damages, dents or scratches to our cars. The owners of the parking lot do look after the cars in the lot and ensure that access is controlled. The location could have been closer to the action, but for the price of the rooms and the parking - it worked out just fine. ActuallyLots of restaurants nearby. The Amish market at the corner of 9th and 49th is amazing. The Hotel is situated quite close to the Lincoln Tunnel. One word of warning - be careful opening the windows. Rather than opening sideways, one window became unhinged and nearly fell on my son's head from the top down. Fortunately, he caught it in time. It is a no frills hotel - but we liked it and have recommended it to others. We will definitely be returning to the Skyline.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: taili
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel for any city, but particularly for New York City. And you can't beat $10 a night for parking - just know in advance that for $10 you can NOT take your car out for the entire visit - one in - one out - but that was fine with me. Room was comfortable and clean and the staff was fine, though not top of the line, but better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great hotel, spacious and clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: pmutter
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel rooms very spacious and very clean. The beds were queen size and very comfortable. The hotel is within easy walking distance of anywhere we wanted to go, time square, subway, theatre district, etc. We travelled with our 4 teenaged children and had two rooms. We all enjoyed the pool, although would have been nice if it had been opened more hours. I would highly recommend this hotel and would certainly stay again. P Mutter, Calgary Alberta, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: montecfo
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip (4th of July) we stayed at the Skyline and truly enjoyed it. We had the King/sleeper sofa room which was a free upgrade from two queens as they did not have that room at the time of checkin. This is an older hotel, but we found it to be well maintained and well run. The room was spacious, beds comfortable. We were on the 7th floor. It was quiet at night, no traffic or street noise. The location is surprisingly convenient to Times Square and the treatre district. We walked to all of our shows and restaurants. The Hell's Kitchen neighborhood is an interesting location, diverse and real. We did not note any safety issues. We wanted to stay in a neighborhood we did not know and this filled the bill. We did not eat in the restaurant or use the garage. My family tends to be a bit slow getting going on vacation, but it was easy for me to run across to the local deli's and get breakfast, which was good and reasonably priced. With this years fireworks over the Hudson we got a bonus. We were only 2-3 blocks from the river and could watch the fireworks from the rooftop.
